<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.GG
<SEQUENCE>3
<FILENAME>dex10gg.htm
<DESCRIPTION>AMENDMENT DATED 12/15/06 TO 2003 LONG -TERM INCENTIVE PLAN
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>AMENDMENT DATED 12/15/06 TO 2003 LONG -TERM INCENTIVE PLAN</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Exhibit 10(gg) </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AMENDMENT TO </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>THE BANK OF NEW YORK COMPANY, INC. </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>2003 LONG-TERM INCENTIVE PLAN </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2"><B>WHEREAS,</B> the 2003 Long-Term Incentive Plan of The Bank of New York Company, Inc.(the &#147;Plan&#148;) was adopted by the Board of Directors of The Bank of New York Company, Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;), effective as of
June&nbsp;1, 2003; and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>WHEREAS,</B> Section&nbsp;16 of the Plan provides that the Board of Directors (the &#147;Board&#148;) may amend
the Plan at any time, except in certain respects not material hereto; and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>WHEREAS,</B> the Board has amended the Plan, effective as of
October&nbsp;9, 2006; and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOW, THEREFORE,</B> subject to the above, the first paragraph of Section&nbsp;15 of the Plan is hereby
amended and restated, effective as of October&nbsp;9, 2006, to read as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>ADJUSTMENT OF AND CHANGES IN STOCK.</B> In the event of
any change in the outstanding shares of Common Stock by reason of any stock dividend or split, recapitalization, merger, consolidation, spinoff, combination or exchange of shares or other corporate change, or any distributions to common shareholders
other than regular cash dividends, the Committee will make such substitution or adjustment, if any, as it deems to be equitable, as to the number or kind of shares of Common Stock or other securities issued or reserved for issuance pursuant to the
Plan and to outstanding Awards. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>IN WITNESS WHEREOF,</B> The Bank of New York Company, Inc. has caused this amendment to be executed by
its duly authorized officers this 15th day of December, 2006. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV ALIGN="right">

<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE III. SCHENECTADY MEMBERS</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I-2</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE IV. KEY BANKS MEMBERS; COMMUNITY BANK MEMBERS</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I-3</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE V. NORSTAR MEMBERS</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I-4</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>

<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE VI. IRVING RETIREMENT PLAN MEMBERS</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I-4</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE VII. NATIONAL COMMUNITY BANK RETIREMENT PLAN MEMBERS</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I-6</FONT></TD></TR>

<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE VIII. PUTNAM TRUST COMPANY RETIREMENT PLAN MEMBERS</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I-8</FONT></TD></TR>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE IX. CERTAIN LITCO RETIREMENT PLAN MEMBERS</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I-10</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">APPENDIX II</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">II-1</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE I. SPECIAL RETIREMENT WINDOW</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">II-1</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE II. BENEFIT INCREASE TO PENSIONERS</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">II-1</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE III. 2002 ENHANCED RETIREMENT BENEFIT</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">II-3</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">RETIREMENT PLAN OF </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">THE BANK OF NEW YORK COMPANY, INC. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>PREAMBLE </U></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Retirement Plan of The Bank of New York Company, Inc. (the &#147;Plan&#148;) was established effective January&nbsp;1, 1972 to provide a means for the
eligible employees of the Company, and each of its Subsidiaries which adopts and participates in the Plan, to accrue retirement benefits. The Plan is intended to be defined benefit pension plan and otherwise satisfy the requirements of
Section&nbsp;401(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended. Effective January&nbsp;1, 1986, the Plan was amended to make it part of a grandfathered floor-offset arrangement described in Revenue Ruling 76-259 and Section&nbsp;9345(a)(3) of
the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1987, P.L.&nbsp;100-203. Accordingly, the Plan operates in conjunction with the Employee Stock Ownership Plan of The Bank of New York, Inc. (the &#147;ESOP&#148;). Assets representing the present value of the
accrued benefits of certain Members were transferred to the ESOP in 1986 and 1988. However, the Plan retains liabilities for these accrued benefits. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Plan has been amended numerous times thereafter to reflect statutory and other changes. The Company hereby amends and restates the Plan, effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2006 to (i)&nbsp;include all amendments
adopted since the last amendment and restatement effective January&nbsp;1, 1994, and (ii)&nbsp;to amend the retirement benefit formula<B><I>.</I></B> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This Amendment and Restatement applies generally to employees who have at least one hour of service on or after January&nbsp;1, 2006. </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE I. <U>Definitions.</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.1 &#147;Accrued Benefit&#148; shall mean, as of any date, the annual amount of the normal retirement benefit payable and nonforfeitable as of a Member&#146;s Normal Retirement Date determined in accordance with the
provisions of Section&nbsp;5.1. In the event a Member&#146;s employment terminates prior to the Member&#146;s Normal Retirement Date, his or her Accrued Benefit shall be determined based on service and compensation through the date employment
terminated. A Member&#146;s Accrued Benefit shall be determined without regard to the Member&#146;s ESOP Account balances for purposes of determining whether the Plan complies with Section&nbsp;411(b)(1) of the Code or complies with the requirement
to provide definitely determinable benefits. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.2 &#147;Actuarial Equivalent&#148; shall mean a benefit of equivalent value to the normal
form of benefit, determined, unless otherwise specified in the text, using the actuarial factors specified in Table&nbsp;A. Table A is incorporated as part of this Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.3 &#147;Affiliate&#148; means (a)&nbsp;any corporation or unincorporated business controlled by, or under common control with, an Employer within the meaning of Section&nbsp;414(b) and (c)&nbsp;of the Code;
(b)&nbsp;any organization which is a member of an affiliated service group which an Employer is a member within the meaning of Section&nbsp;414(m) of the Code; and (c)&nbsp;any entity required to be aggregated with the Employer pursuant to
Section&nbsp;414(o) of the Code; provided, however, that, for purposes of the limitations contained in Article&nbsp;VI, &#147;Affiliate&#148; status shall be determined in accordance with Section&nbsp;415(h) of the Code. A corporation or
unincorporated business shall not be deemed an </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-2- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Affiliate for any purpose under the Plan with respect to any period before it became an Affiliate. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.4 &#147;Average Final Compensation&#148; shall mean the arithmetical average of the Member&#146;s annual Compensation for the highest five consecutive
years of Credited Service (determined without regard to breaks in service) of the last ten years of his Credited Service, immediately preceding the date of his retirement or earlier termination of service; provided, however, that if a Member shall
have been employed more than five but less than ten years, such average shall be based upon the highest five consecutive years of Credited Service of such shorter period, and provided further, that if a Member shall have been employed for five years
or less, such average shall be based upon all the years of Credited Service for such period. Notwithstanding any provision of the Plan to the contrary, Average Final Compensation for Members who remain employed with the Company on or after
January&nbsp;1, 2006 shall be determined as of December&nbsp;31, 2005. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.5 &#147;Board of Directors of the Company&#148; shall mean
(a)&nbsp;the Board of Directors of the Company or the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors of the Company, and (b)&nbsp;other than with respect to the termination of the Plan or amendments of the Plan which would (i)&nbsp;significantly
reduce or increase benefits under the Plan or (ii)&nbsp;have a material financial impact on the Plan, the Pension Committee of the Board of Directors of the Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.6 &#147;Code&#148; shall mean the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-3- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.7 &#147;Committee&#148; shall mean the Retirement Plan Committee constituted to administer the Plan as
provided in Section&nbsp;10.1. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.8 &#147;Company&#148; shall mean The Bank of New York Company, Inc. or any successor thereto. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.9 &#147;Compensation&#148; shall mean the regular fixed basic salary received from the Company, a Subsidiary or Affiliate by an Employee during a
year, including the amount, if any, by which the regular fixed basic salary is reduced under the terms of The Bank of New York Company, Inc. Benefits Plus Plan or the Employees&#146; Incentive Savings Plan of The Bank of New York, Inc., or effective
January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2001, any qualified transportation fringe benefit plan described in Section&nbsp;132(f) of the Code, but exclusive of profit-sharing distributions and other special payments. There shall also be included in determining the
&#147;Compensation&#148; of Employees of BNY Mortgage Company, Inc. the commissions earned by those Employees who are paid only on a commission basis. Except as provided in the succeeding paragraph, in no event shall Compensation for purposes of the
Plan for any Plan Year beginning after December&nbsp;31, 1993 and before January&nbsp;1, 2002, exceed $150,000, as adjusted to reflect increases in the cost of living pursuant to Section&nbsp;401(a)(17) of the Code. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Effective as of the first day of the first Plan Year beginning after December&nbsp;31, 2001, with respect to Members who complete at least one Hour of
Service on or after January&nbsp;1, 2002, the Compensation of each Member taken into account in determining benefit accruals in any Plan Year, shall not exceed $200,000. The $200,000 limit on Compensation shall be adjusted for cost-of-living
increases in accordance with Section </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-4- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">401(a)(17)(B) of the Code. The cost-of-living adjustment in effect for a calendar year applies to Compensation for the determination period that begins with
or within such calendar year. For purposes of determining benefit accruals in a Plan Year beginning after December&nbsp;31, 2001, the Compensation limit for any prior determination period shall be $200,000. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:3px; text-indent:4%;line-Height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In determining a Member&#146;s Compensation, an increase in the rate of the Member&#146;s pay that goes into effect
on or prior to the 15</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#000000"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> day of a month shall be deemed to be in effect for the entire month, and an increase that
goes into effect after the 15</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#000000"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> day of a month shall not be deemed effective until the first day of the following
month. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.10 &#147;Contributing Company&#148; shall mean (i)&nbsp;the Company; (ii)&nbsp;each Subsidiary and division, operating unit,
department or group of employees of a Subsidiary which was included in the Plan as of December&nbsp;31, 1995; and (iii)&nbsp;thereafter, each new Subsidiary or Affiliate and division, operating unit, department or group of employees of a Subsidiary
or Affiliate, whose participation in the Plan has been approved by the Head of Human Resources of The Bank of New York. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:3px; text-indent:4%;line-Height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.11 &#147;Early Retirement Date&#148; means any date after a Member&#146;s 55</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#000000"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">
birthday and prior to Normal Retirement Age, selected by such Member in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.3. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.12 &#147;Effective Date&#148;
of the Plan shall mean January&nbsp;1, 1972. The Effective Date of this Amendment and Restatement is January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2006 or such later date specified herein. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-5- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.13 &#147;Employee&#148; means any person who is employed by and receives Compensation from the Company
or any Affiliate. Additionally, any individual who performs services for the Company or any Affiliate under an agreement or arrangement (which may be written, or oral, and/or evidenced by the payroll practices of the Company or any Affiliate) with
the individual or with any other organization that provides the services of the individual to the Company or any Affiliate<I>,</I> pursuant to which the individual is treated as an independent contractor or is otherwise treated as an employee of an
entity other than the Company or any Affiliate<I>, </I>shall not be an Employee irrespective of whether he/she is treated as an employee of the Company or any Affiliate under common-law employment principles, by any court or regulatory agency, or
pursuant to the provisions of Sections 414(m), 414(n) or 414(o) of the Code. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.14 &#147;ERISA&#148; means the Employee Retirement Income
Security Act of 1974, as amended. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.15 &#147;ESOP&#148; means the Employee Stock Ownership Plan of The Bank of New York Company, Inc., as
constituted from time to time. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.16 A &#147;Full-Time Employee&#148; means an Employee who is on the payroll of the Company or Affiliate,
is assigned the identifying code for a full-time employee, and is hired on the basis that he will be scheduled to work on a full-time basis for at least twelve (12)&nbsp;months. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.17 &#147;Hour of Service&#148; means: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) Each hour for which an Employee is paid or entitled to payment for the performance of duties. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-6- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) Each hour for which an Employee is directly or indirectly paid or is entitled to be
paid by an Employer during a period in which no duties are performed (for example, due to vacation, holidays, illness, disability, layoff, jury duty, temporary military duty, or leave of absence) is an Hour of Service. However, except that in
considering whether a break in service has occurred, no more than 501 Hours of Service shall be credited for any single continuous period during which the Employee performs no duties. Further, no Hours of Service shall be credited on account of
payments made solely under a plan maintained to comply with worker&#146;s compensation, unemployment compensation, or disability insurance laws, or to reimburse Employees for medical expenses. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iii) Each hour for which back pay (ignoring any mitigation of damages) is either awarded or agreed to by an Employer is an Hour of
Service. However, no more than 501 Hours of Service shall be credited for any single continuous period during which the Employee would not have performed any duties. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iv) Hours of Service shall be credited in any one period only under one of (i), (ii)&nbsp;and (iii), and an Employee may not get double
credit for the same period. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In all respects, an Employee&#146;s Hours of Service shall be counted as required by
Section&nbsp;2530.200b-2 of the Department of Labor&#146;s regulations under Title&nbsp;I of ERISA. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-7- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.18 &#147;Indexation Factor&#148; shall mean the quotient obtained by dividing the Member&#146;s Average
Final Compensation at the time of retirement or other termination of service by the Member&#146;s Average Final Compensation as of December&nbsp;31, 2005. For terminations during 2006, this factor shall not exceed (1 + 0.01 * Q/12), where
&#147;Q&#148; equals the number of whole months of Continuous Service performed by the Member during 2006. For terminations during 2007 or later years, this factor shall not exceed (1.01)^Q, where &#147;Q&#148; equals the number of years and months
of Continuous Service performed after December&nbsp;31, 2005 until retirement or other termination of service. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:3px; text-indent:4%;line-Height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">For this purpose, a Member shall be given credit for an entire month of Continuous Service for any month in which he works until at least the 16</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#000000"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> day of the month. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.19 &#147;Member&#148; shall mean any Employee who becomes a Member in
the Plan as provided in Section&nbsp;2.1. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.20 &#147;Normal Retirement Age&#148; shall mean a Member&#146;s 60th birthday. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.21 A &#147;Part-Time Employee&#148; means any Employee who is not a Full-Time Employee. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.22 &#147;Plan&#148; shall mean the Retirement Plan of The Bank of New York Company, Inc. as described herein or as from time to time hereafter amended.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.23 &#147;Plan Year&#148; means the twelve month period beginning on January&nbsp;1 and ending on December&nbsp;31 and shall also be the
limitation year for purposes of Section&nbsp;415 of the Code. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-8- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.24 &#147;Predecessor&#148; means any company which, directly or indirectly, was acquired at any time by
the Company or a Subsidiary by merger, acquisition of assets or otherwise. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.25 &#147;Primary Social Security Benefit&#148; shall mean the
amount estimated by the Committee in accordance with (a)&nbsp;below of the monthly old age Primary Social Security Benefit under the Social Security Act in effect at the Member&#146;s retirement date or other termination of employment date which
would be payable to the Member on his normal retirement date appropriately adjusted in accordance with (b)&nbsp;below. For purposes of determining a Member&#146;s benefit under Section&nbsp;5.1(a), the Primary Social Security Benefit for Members who
remain employed with the Company on or after January&nbsp;1, 2006 shall be determined assuming such Member terminated employment or retired on December&nbsp;31, 2005. For purposes of determining the amount of a Member&#146;s benefit payments under
the Social Security level income option (Option 3 under Section&nbsp;6.3(a) of the Plan), the Primary Social Security Benefit shall be determined as of the Member&#146;s retirement or other termination of employment. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) The Primary Social Security Benefit estimated by the Committee shall be determined by referring to tables prepared by the Plan&#146;s actuary on the
following basis: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) In the case of a Member who has attained his Early or Normal Retirement Date as of the date of
termination of employment, for purposes of determining the wages used in the calculation of the Primary Social Security Benefit, the Member shall be deemed to receive no income </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-9- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">after the date of retirement which would be treated as wages for the purposes of the Social Security Act, and before the date of his retirement, compensation
shall be imputed in accordance with (iii)&nbsp;below<B>,</B> provided that for the calendar year immediately preceding his retirement his imputed compensation should equal his actual Compensation. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The table shall specify the Primary Social Security Benefit applicable to a Member, with adjustment to reflect the Member&#146;s Social
Security Retirement Age, based on his last calendar year&#146;s Compensation. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%;line-Height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) In
the case of a Member who terminates employment with a vested benefit before eligibility for retirement, for purposes of determining the wages used in the calculation of the Primary Social Security Benefit, the Member shall be deemed to receive each
year after the date of termination until his 55th birthday (or his 55</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#000000"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> birthday for purposes of determining the
Member&#146;s benefit under Section&nbsp;5.1(a)) as wages for the purpose of the Social Security Act an amount equal to his annual earnings at the date of last employment, and before his date of termination of employment, the Member shall be deemed
to have received compensation imputed in accordance with (iii)&nbsp;below, provided that for the year immediately preceding his termination of employment his imputed compensation shall equal his actual Compensation. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-10- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The table shall specify the Primary Social Security Benefit applicable at Social Security
Retirement Age according to the Member&#146;s year of birth and last calendar year&#146;s Compensation. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iii) The
Member&#146;s imputed earnings for each year prior to the date of calculation shall be equal to the next succeeding year&#146;s imputed earnings multiplied by the ratio of the &#147;Average National Earnings&#148; published by the Social Security
Administration for such year divided by the &#147;Average National Earnings&#148; for the succeeding year. If no &#147;Average National Earnings&#148; has yet been published by the Social Security Administration for a year, it shall be taken to be
the last such published figure increased (or decreased) at the same annual rate as was revealed by the last two such published figures. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">(b) For the purposes of determining the amount of Primary Social Security Benefit to be used in the calculation of the retirement allowance set forth in Article&nbsp;V hereof: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) in the event a Member retires on and after his 62nd birthday the estimated Primary Social Security Benefit calculated in
(a)&nbsp;above shall be reduced by 5/9% for each month that his actual retirement precedes his 65th birthday, and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) the
Primary Social Security Benefit of a Member who retires prior to age&nbsp;62 or terminates his service with a vested right shall be adjusted to 80% of the estimated Primary Social Security Benefit </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-11- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">calculated in (a)&nbsp;above for a Member whose Social Security Retirement Age is 65. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) Where the Member at his death leaves a spouse eligible for a Spouse&#146;s Death Benefit under Article&nbsp;VII, the Primary Social Security Benefit
shall be determined as above assuming the Member had retired on the date of his death. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d) The Primary Social Security Benefit of a Member
who retires on or after age&nbsp;62 shall be equal to the lesser of (i)&nbsp;his Primary Social Security Benefit calculated in accordance with (a)&nbsp;and (b)&nbsp;above or (ii)&nbsp;the actual benefit which would have been payable to him at that
age, as demonstrated by the Member to the satisfaction of the Committee. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(e) A Member&#146;s retirement benefits shall not be reduced by
reason of any increase in wage base or benefit levels payable under Title&nbsp;II of the Social Security Act if such increase takes place after the earlier of the date such Member receives such benefits or the date he separates from service.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(f) Notwithstanding any provision of this Section&nbsp;1.25 to the contrary, a Member&#146;s Primary Social Security Benefit shall be
determined based on the Member&#146;s actual salary history with respect to any year prior to the Member&#146;s termination of employment for which his salary was estimated, provided that the Member furnishes satisfactory documentation to the
Committee prior to the commencement of benefit payments. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.26 &#147;Prior Plan&#148; shall mean any retirement plan qualified under
Section&nbsp;401(a) of the Code which is merged into this Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-12- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.27 &#147;Profit-Sharing Plan&#148; shall mean the Employees&#146; Profit-Sharing Plan of The Bank of
New York Company,&nbsp;Inc., as amended from time to time. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.28 &#147;Resumption of Service Commencement Date&#148; means the date on
which an Employee first performs an Hour of Service following a break in service which is not counted in determining his Continuous Service pursuant to Section&nbsp;3.1(a). </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.29 &#147;Service Commencement Date&#148; shall mean: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) for Full-Time Employees, the date on which an Employee first completes an Hour of Service following initial employment by the Company or any Affiliate or reemployment after having incurred a one-year break in
service (as defined in Section&nbsp;3.1), and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) for Part-Time Employees, (A)&nbsp;January&nbsp;1, 2000 for each Employee
who was a Part-Time Employee on January&nbsp;1, 2000 and who was employed by the Company or an Affiliate at any time during the 12&nbsp;month period ending on December&nbsp;31, 1999 and (B)&nbsp;for each other Part-Time Employee, the date on which
he first performs an hour of service for the Company or an Affiliate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Service Commencement Date shall
be January&nbsp;1, 1999 for each Employee who (i)&nbsp;was a Part-Time Employee on January&nbsp;1, 2000, (ii)&nbsp;was employed by the Company or an Affiliate at any time during the 12-month period ending on December&nbsp;31, 1999 and (iii)&nbsp;did
not complete 1,000 Hours of Service during the 12-month period ending on December&nbsp;31, 2000. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-13- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.30 &#147;Social Security Retirement Age&#148; shall mean age&nbsp;65 for a Member born prior to 1938;
age&nbsp;66 for a Member born on or after 1938, but prior to 1955; and age&nbsp;67 for a Member born on or after 1955. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.31
&#147;Subsidiary&#148; shall mean any corporation, whether organized under the Banking Law of the State of New York or some other statute, in which the Company owns directly or indirectly stock possessing at least 80% of the voting power of all
classes of stock regularly entitled to vote for the election of directors. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.32 &#147;Trustee&#148; shall mean The Bank of New York as
trustee for the Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.33 &#147;Trust Fund&#148; shall mean the fund held by the Trustee to which all contributions to the Plan will be
paid and out of which all benefits of the Plan will be paid. Such fund may be part of a master trust with the fund of any other retirement plan maintained by the Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.34 &#147;Trust Indenture&#148; shall mean the Trust Indenture between the Company and the Trustee. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE II.
<U>Membership.</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.1 (a) Each Employee who was a Member on December&nbsp;31, 1999 shall continue to be a Member. Each other Employee who
is not excluded under Paragraph 2.1(b) and who (i)&nbsp;is in the employment of a Contributing Company or (ii)&nbsp;was in the service of a Contributing Company and was transferred to a Subsidiary shall, except as provided in paragraph&nbsp;(b) of
this Section, become a Member as of the latest of the date he attains age&nbsp;21 and satisfies all of the applicable requirements which </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-14- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">follow:&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;he completes one year of Continuous Service if he is a Full-Time Employee or (B)&nbsp;he completes 1,000 Hours of Service in the
12-month period starting on his Service Commencement Date or any anniversary thereof if he is a Part-Time Employee, or (C)&nbsp;he becomes eligible to become a Member by becoming employed by a Contributing Company. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Notwithstanding the above, a Member whose employment is transferred to a Subsidiary or Affiliate or a division, unit, department or group of employees of
a Subsidiary or Affiliate which is not a Contributing Company shall, except to the extent determined by the Head of Human Resources of The Bank of New York on a uniform and nondiscriminatory basis for similarly situated employees, cease to be a
Member as of the date of such transfer, but shall continue to earn Continuous Service under the Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) Notwithstanding
paragraph&nbsp;(a) of this Section, an Employee shall not be eligible to become a Member if he (i)&nbsp;is included in a unit of employees covered by a collective bargaining agreement for which retirement benefits were the subject of good faith
bargaining between employee representatives and a Contributing Company, (ii)&nbsp;is hired by a real estate agent to perform maintenance and operational services on any Contributing Company&#146;s premises, (iii)&nbsp;is employed by and principally
assigned to an office of a Contributing Company located outside the United States, or (iv)&nbsp;is employed by a Subsidiary, or Affiliate, or division, unit, department or group of employees of a Subsidiary or Affiliate which is not a Contributing
Company (or another unit, department or group of Employees which does not participate in this Plan), and the Head of Human </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-15- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Resources of The Bank of New York has determined on a uniform and nondiscriminatory basis for similarly situated employees that he is an excluded Employee.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) Part-Time Employees and Full-Time Employees shall be subject to different rules with respect to eligibility or re-eligibility for
membership in the Plan, but once an Employee becomes a Member the Plan shall not differentiate between Part-Time Employees and Full-Time Employees. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">(d) A Part-Time Employee who becomes a Member pursuant to Section&nbsp;2.1(a) shall be credited with one year of Continuous Service for the 12&nbsp;month period following his Service Commencement Date or Resumption of Service Commencement
Date, or any monthly anniversary thereof, in which he completes 1,000 Hours of Service. Thereafter, his Continuous Service shall be computed in accordance with the elapsed time method in Section&nbsp;3.1 as if his Service Commencement Date was the
day following the end of the 12-month period in which he first completes 1,000 Hours of Service. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Continuous Service of a Part-Time Employee who becomes a Member pursuant to Section&nbsp;2.1(a) and who was an
Employee on January&nbsp;1, 2000 shall be computed in accordance with the elapsed time method in Section&nbsp;3.1 as if his Service Commencement Date was the date he first performed an Hour of Service for the Company or a Subsidiary. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.2 A Member who enters the military service of the United States or with the approval of the Committee is temporarily absent for any other cause, and
who, without intervening employment, returns to the employment of a Contributing Company immediately after the period of absence approved by the Committee or within three </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-16- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">months after discharge from such military service, as the case may be, shall be credited with Continuous Service for the period of such military service or
absence. If the base period used in calculating a Member&#146;s Average Final Compensation for purposes of determining the Member&#146;s benefit under Section&nbsp;5.1(a), or the period during which the Member is entitled to a benefit based on his
Compensation under Section&nbsp;5.1(b), includes one or more periods of such military service or absence, such Member shall be deemed to have received throughout each period of military service or absence (i)&nbsp;the Compensation he would have
received during such period if he had not been in military service, or (ii)&nbsp;if the Compensation he would have received during such period is not reasonably certain, the greater of (A)&nbsp;the Participant&#146;s average Compensation during the
12-month period immediately prior to such period of military service or absence (or if shorter, the period of employment immediately preceding such military service or absence) or (B)&nbsp;the Compensation he was receiving immediately at the start
of such military service or absence. Effective December&nbsp;12, 1994, this provision shall cover all service required to be recognized under Section&nbsp;414(u) of the Code. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.3 If a Member ceases active service with a Contributing Company on account of becoming mentally or physically incapacitated, and becomes eligible to
receive benefits under the long-term disability plan, under which he is covered as an Employee, such Member shall continue to be treated as a Member and shall accrue Credited Service until age sixty-five or the earlier commencement of retirement
benefits; provided, however, the Compensation and Average Final Compensation of such Member shall be frozen (except that cost-of-living increases under Section&nbsp;1.9 shall be applicable) </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-17- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">and shall be computed on the basis of the Member&#146;s Compensation prior to the date on which the Member is treated as incapacitated under the Plan. If the
Member is no longer eligible to receive benefits under the applicable long-term disability plan and does not return to active service with a Contributing Company, such Member shall be treated as though he had terminated service with a Contributing
Company. The Committee may require any Member who is covered by the provisions of this subsection to undergo periodic medical examinations to determine his continued eligibility hereunder. Should any such Member refuse to undergo any examination,
his membership in the Plan shall cease in the same manner as described immediately above but he shall not be deprived of any previously accrued benefit. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Membership in the Plan shall cease on the date a Member&#146;s Continuous Service ceases in accordance with Section&nbsp;3.1(a). Upon re-entry into employment with a Contributing Company an Employee&#146;s membership
in the Plan shall resume on his Resumption of Service Commencement Date, provided that (i)&nbsp;he is not ineligible pursuant to Section&nbsp;2.1(b) and (ii)&nbsp;he thereafter completes (A)&nbsp;a one year period of Continuous Service if he is a
Full-Time Employee, or (B)&nbsp;1,000 Hours of Service in the 12-month period following his Resumption of Service Commencement Date or any monthly anniversary thereof if he is a Part-Time Employee. Notwithstanding the preceding sentence, an
Employee&#146;s membership in the Plan shall resume on his Resumption of Service Commencement Date if (a)&nbsp;he has completed at least five years of Service or (b)&nbsp;the number of his one year breaks in service does not equal or exceed the
</FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-18- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">greater of (i)&nbsp;five or (ii)&nbsp;the aggregate years of Continuous Service prior to his break in service. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE III. <U>Types of Service.</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.1 For purposes of
this Plan, a Member&#146;s years of service for eligibility and vesting shall be determined in accordance with the following: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">(a) Continuous Service means an Employee&#146;s period of uninterrupted service with the Contributing Companies, Predecessor or any Affiliate beginning with the Employee&#146;s Service Commencement Date with no breaks in service which would
terminate employment. It shall include all periods during which a Member receives benefits under the Company&#146;s or his employer&#146;s long-term disability insurance and any waiting period preceding payment of such benefits. Continuous Service
shall not include all years of such service prior to the Member&#146;s eighteenth birthday. Continuous Service shall not be considered broken by: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) a period of service with the Armed Forces of The United States of America if an Employee, who left active service with a Contributing Company to enter and did directly enter such Armed Forces, returned to active
employment within the time and under the conditions which entitle him to reemployment rights under the laws of The United States of America, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) the period covered by an authorized leave of absence, as defined in Section&nbsp;2.2, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-19- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iii) transfer directly from the employment of the Company or a Subsidiary to the
employment of the Company or another Subsidiary or Affiliate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If an Employee or Member whose Continuous Service is broken after January&nbsp;1, 1985 is
subsequently reemployed and he thereafter meets the definition of Employee, his prior Continuous Service shall be reinstated if he had met the requirements for a vested benefit under Section&nbsp;9.1 at the time his prior Continuous Service was
broken, or the number of his one year breaks in service does not equal or exceed the greater of five or the aggregate years of Continuous Service prior to his break in service. Service with (a)&nbsp;a corporation which is a Subsidiary prior to the
date such corporation became a Subsidiary or (b)&nbsp;with a division, operating unit or department of the Company or a Subsidiary prior to the date such division, operating unit or department became a division, operating unit or department of the
Company or a Subsidiary shall, except to the extent provided by the Head of Human Resources of The Bank of New York on a uniform and nondiscriminatory basis for similarly situated employees, be excluded from Continuous Service. Notwithstanding the
foregoing sentence, (i)&nbsp;the Continuous Service of any former employee of Irving Bank Corporation and its subsidiaries who is hired by a Contributing Company after November&nbsp;29, 1988, shall include service with Irving Bank Corporation and
its subsidiaries, (ii)&nbsp;the Continuous Service of employees of Barclays Bank PLC (&#147;Barclays&#148;) and Barclays Bank of New York (&#147;BBNY&#148;) who become Employees on the &#147;Closing Date&#148;, as defined in Section&nbsp;7.7(a) of
the Purchase and Assumption Agreement, dated as of June&nbsp;17, 1992, among Barclays, BBNY and The </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-20- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Bank of New York (without regard to the second sentence of subsection (iii)&nbsp;thereof), shall include service with Barclays, BBNY or its or their
affiliates (including periods of employment with any other employer which are taken into account under the Barclays Bank PLC USA Staff Pension Plan) prior to such Closing Date, (iii)&nbsp;the Continuous Service of Employees of The Bank of New York
NA, National Community Division (&#147;National Community Employees&#148;) shall include service with National Community Bank of New Jersey and its predecessors prior to the &#147;Effective Time&#148;, as defined in the Agreement and Plan of Merger,
dated as of January&nbsp;29, 1993, by and among the Company, B.N.Y. Holdings (New Jersey) Corporation and National Community Banks, Inc., (iv)&nbsp;the Continuous Service of Employees of BNY Mortgage Company, Inc. on July&nbsp;1, 1995 (&#147;BNY
Mortgage Employees&#148;) shall include service with ARCS Mortgage, Inc. prior to July&nbsp;1, 1995, (v)&nbsp;the Continuous Service of Employees of Putnam Trust Company shall include service with The Putnam Trust Company of Greenwich and its
predecessors prior to the &#147;Effective Time&#148; as defined in the Agreement and Plan of Merger dated as of March&nbsp;25, 1995 by and between the Company and The Putnam Trust Company of Greenwich, (vi)&nbsp;the Continuous Service of
&#147;Employees&#148; who accept employment with the &#147;Buyer Parties&#148;, as such terms are defined in the Purchase and Sale Agreement, dated as of April&nbsp;21, 1995, by and among BankAmerica Corporation, the Sellers named on Exhibit&nbsp;A
attached thereto, and The Bank of New York Company, Inc. (the &#147;BankAmerica Agreement&#148;), shall include service with the &#147;BankAmerica Parties&#148; and their &#147;Affiliates&#148;, as such terms are defined in the BankAmerica
Agreement, (vii)&nbsp;the Continuous Service of &#147;Transferred Employees&#148;, as such term is defined in the Asset </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-21- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Purchase Agreement, dated as of May&nbsp;22, 1995, between Morgan Guaranty Trust Company of New York and The Bank of New York (the &#147;Morgan Guaranty
Agreement&#148;), shall include service with Morgan Guaranty Trust Company of New York and any &#147;Affiliate&#148;, as such term is defined in the Morgan Guaranty Agreement, and (viii)&nbsp;the Continuous Service of &#147;Transferred
Employees&#148;, as such term is defined in the Asset Purchase Agreement between The Bank of New York and NationsBank Corporation, dated as of May&nbsp;30, 1995 (the &#147;NationsBank Agreement&#148;), shall include service with NationsBank
Corporation and its affiliates. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Effective January&nbsp;1, 1976 for purposes of the Plan, a &#147;one-year break in service&#148; with
respect to an Employee shall be deemed to have occurred at the end of the 12 consecutive month period beginning on the date such Employee severs his service. If an Employee severs his service but is reemployed prior to incurring a &#147;one-year
break in service&#148;, the period of time between his severance from employment and his reemployment shall be counted as Continuous Service for purposes of membership and vesting but not as Credited Service for purposes of benefit accrual.
Effective January&nbsp;1, 1985 for purposes of determining whether a &#147;one-year break in service&#148; has occurred for purposes of membership and vesting (but not for benefit accrual), a Full-Time Employee who is absent from employment due to a
&#147;maternity absence&#148; shall not be deemed to have severed service until the first anniversary of the first day of such maternity absence (so that the adjusted &#147;one-year break in service&#148; date shall be the second anniversary of the
first day of such maternity absence). The period of time between the first and second anniversary of the first day of such maternity absence shall not be counted as a period of </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-22- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">service or a period of severance. A Part-Time Employee who is absent from employment due to a &#147;maternity absence&#148; shall be credited with the number
of hours she would normally be scheduled to work, up to a maximum of 501, for the year before the maternity absence (if such hours are necessary to prevent a break in service for that year), or for the following year. A &#147;maternity absence&#148;
for purposes of this paragraph means a period during which an Employee is absent from work for any period by reason of the pregnancy of the Employee, the birth of a child of the Employee, the placement of a child with the Employee in connection with
the adoption of such child by such Employee, or for the purposes of caring for such child for a period beginning immediately following such pregnancy, birth or placement. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) Credited Service shall mean a Member&#146;s years and months of Continuous Service with a Contributing Company, up to a maximum of
forty years, and after becoming a Member; provided, however, (i)&nbsp;if a Member is transferred to employment with a Subsidiary or Affiliate or a division, operating unit, department or group of employees of a Subsidiary or Affiliate which is not a
Contributing Company, such Continuous Service will not, except to the extent provided by the Head of Human Resources of The Bank of New York on a uniform and nondiscriminatory basis for similarly situated employees, be counted in determining
Credited Service, (ii)&nbsp;if a Member was a member of a Prior Plan or a qualified plan of a Predecessor which was merged into this Plan prior to becoming a Member, such period of membership shall also be counted in determining Credited Service,
(iii)&nbsp;if a Member was an employee of Irving Bank </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-23- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Corporation and its subsidiaries and is hired by a Contributing Company after November&nbsp;29, 1988, Continuous Service credited for service with Irving
Bank Corporation and its subsidiaries shall not be counted in determining Credited Service, and (iv)&nbsp;the Continuous Service, prior to becoming a Member, of a part-time employee who was an Employee on January&nbsp;1, 2000 shall also be counted
in determining Credited Service, other than (x)&nbsp;the first year of such Continuous Service, (y)&nbsp;Continuous Service prior to August&nbsp;11, 1993 for employees of National Community Bank of New Jersey and its predecessors who did not
complete 1,000 hours of service in the 12-month period ending December&nbsp;31, 1993 and (z)&nbsp;Continuous Service prior to November&nbsp;1, 1995 for employees of Putnam Trust Company and its predecessors who did not complete 1,000 Hours of
Service in the 12-month period ending December&nbsp;31, 1995. Notwithstanding the foregoing sentence, in determining Credited Service there shall be excluded the Continuous Service which is taken into account pursuant to the sixth sentence of
Section&nbsp;3.1(a) of (i)&nbsp;employees of Barclays and BBNY, (ii)&nbsp;BNY Mortgage Employees, (iii)&nbsp;&#147;Employees&#148; who accept employment with the &#147;Buyer Parties&#148;, as such terms are defined in the BankAmerica Agreement,
(iv)&nbsp;&#147;Transferred Employees&#148;, as such term is defined in the Morgan Guaranty Agreement, and (v)&nbsp;&#147;Transferred Employees&#148;, as such term is defined in the NationsBank Agreement. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-24- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE IV. <U>Retirement Dates.</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.1 <U>Normal Retirement and Deferred Retirement</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Any Member in service who has attained or attains
Normal Retirement Age on or after the Effective Date shall be retired under this Plan if such Member makes written application therefor to the Committee setting forth a date after the Member&#146;s Normal Retirement Age not less than sixty nor more
than ninety days following the date of the application. The Committee shall retire such Member as of the close of business on the day requested by the Member. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.2 <U>Mandatory Retirement</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Each Member in service who is employed in a &#147;bona fide executive or
high policy making position&#148; as such terms are defined in the Age Discrimination in Employment Act Amendments of 1978 for the two years immediately preceding his retirement and who is entitled to immediate nonforfeitable annual retirement
benefits from the Plan, the Profit-Sharing Plan and the ESOP and any other Plan required to be counted for this purpose (on a straight life annuity basis) totaling $44,000 a year, shall be retired under this Plan by the Committee as of the close of
business on the last day of the calendar month during which such Member attains age sixty-five unless the Pension Committee of the Board of Directors informs the Committee that it requests the Member not be retired. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.3 <U>Early Retirement</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Any Member in
service who has attained or attains age fifty-five on or after the Effective Date shall be retired under this Plan if such Member makes written application therefor to the Committee setting forth a date after the Member&#146;s fifty-fifth birthday
not </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-25- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">less than sixty nor more than ninety days following the date of the application. The Committee shall retire such Member as of the close of business on the
day requested by the Member. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.4 <U>Effect of Certain Dispositions</U> </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the event of the disposition by the Company or a Subsidiary to an unrelated purchaser of all or substantially all of the stock or other equity
interests in any corporation, partnership or other entity (the &#147;Former Affiliate&#148;) which is either a member of the same controlled group of corporations (within the meaning of Section&nbsp;414(b) of the Code) as the Company or a trade or
business under common control (within the meaning of Section&nbsp;414(c) of the Code) with the Company, a Member employed by such Former Affiliate at the time of such disposition may retire for purposes of Section&nbsp;4.1 and 4.3 if (i)&nbsp;the
Plan continues to be maintained by the Company and (ii)&nbsp;the agreement for such disposition does not provide that (A)&nbsp;the Plan will be maintained by the Former Affiliate, the unrelated purchaser or any other employer which is a member of
the same controlled group of corporations as the unrelated purchaser or is a trade or business under common control with the unrelated purchaser or (B)&nbsp;assets and liabilities of the Plan will be transferred to a defined benefit plan of the
Former Affiliate, the unrelated purchaser or any other employer which is a member of the same controlled group of corporations as the unrelated purchaser or is a trade or business under common control with the unrelated purchaser. Notwithstanding
anything contained in the Plan to the contrary, for purposes of determining the Actuarial Equivalent of an optional form of payment of the retirement benefit (other than Option&nbsp;5) of a Member who retires as of the closing date of the </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-26- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">disposition of the Former Affiliate, the annual interest rate shall be the lesser of the applicable rate on (A)&nbsp;the original anticipated closing date of
such disposition which was communicated to affected Members or (B)&nbsp;the actual closing date of such disposition. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE V. <U>Retirement
Benefits.</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5.1 <U>Normal Retirement Benefit</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The annual retirement benefit payable to a Member on his attainment of Normal Retirement Age shall be an amount equal to (a)&nbsp;plus (b), and reduced (when applicable) by the ESOP offset described in (c)::
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) <U>Pre-2006 Final Average Pay Benefit</U>: The sum of (i)&nbsp;and (ii)&nbsp;multiplied (when applicable) by the
&#147;Indexation Factor&#148; as provided (iii), in each case as described below: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) 1.5% of Member&#146;s Average Final
Compensation multiplied by his years of Credited Service prior to January&nbsp;1, 1976; <U>plus</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) 1.65% of
Member&#146;s Average Final Compensation minus 1.25% of the Member&#146;s Primary Social Security Benefit, in each case multiplied by his years of Credited Service after December&nbsp;31, 1975 and prior to January&nbsp;1, 2006 (which, when combined
with the years of Credited Service counted under (i)&nbsp;shall not exceed 40 years); <U>and </U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iii) For Members in
Continuous Service with a Contributing Company on or after January&nbsp;1, 2006, the sum (i)&nbsp;and (ii)&nbsp;shall be multiplied by the Indexation Factor. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-27- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) <U>Post-2005 Career Average Pay Benefit</U>: The sum of 1% of the Member&#146;s
Compensation for each year of Credited Service beginning on or after January&nbsp;1, 2006, provided that the total of the years of Credited Service counted under Section&nbsp;5.1(a) and this Section&nbsp;5.1(b) shall not exceed 40. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) <U>ESOP Offset</U>: In the case of a Member who also participates in the ESOP, the total benefit produced by the sum of (a)&nbsp;and
(b)&nbsp;shall be reduced on and after January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;1986 by the Actuarial Equivalent of the vested portion of a Member&#146;s account under the ESOP. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the reduction provided in this subsection (c)&nbsp;shall not
be made if prior to the payment or commencement of payment to the Member&#146;s retirement benefits hereunder a transfer is made to the Plan of the Member&#146;s vested account under the ESOP, and no Member&#146;s accrued benefit as of
December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;1985 shall be retroactively reduced by the amendment that originally implemented the ESOP offset described in this subsection (c). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Notwithstanding any other provision in the Plan, the Accrued Benefit of each TRA&nbsp;86 Member will be the greater of: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) the Member&#146;s normal retirement benefit as of December&nbsp;31, 1988, frozen in accordance with Section&nbsp;1.401(a)(4)-13 of the Income Tax Regulations, and </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) the Member&#146;s normal retirement benefit determined under the first paragraph of this Section&nbsp;with respect to all of the
Member&#146;s years of Credited Service. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-28- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For purposes of this paragraph, a &#147;TRA&nbsp;86 Member&#148; means a Member whose Accrued Benefit as of a date on or
after the first day of the Plan Year beginning on January&nbsp;1, 1989, is based on Compensation for a year beginning prior to the Plan Year beginning on January&nbsp;1, 1989, that exceeded $200,000. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Unless provided otherwise under the Plan, each OBRA&nbsp;93 Member&#146;s Accrued Benefit will be the greater of: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) the Member&#146;s normal retirement benefit determined under the first paragraph of this Section&nbsp;with respect to all of the
Member&#146;s years of Credited Service, or </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) the sum of: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:13%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(A) the Member&#146;s normal retirement benefit as of December&nbsp;31, 1993, frozen in accordance with Section&nbsp;1.401(a)(4)-13 of
the Income Tax Regulations, and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:13%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(B) the Member&#146;s normal retirement benefit determined under the first paragraph of
this Section&nbsp;with respect to the Member&#146;s Credited Service credited to the Member for Plan Years beginning on or after January&nbsp;1, 1994. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For
purposes of this paragraph, an &#147;OBRA 93 Member&#148; means a Member whose Accrued Benefit as of a date on or after the first day of the Plan Year beginning on January&nbsp;1, 1994 is based on Compensation for a year beginning prior to the Plan
Year beginning on January&nbsp;1, 1994 that exceeded $150,000. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-29- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5.2 <U>Deferred Retirement Benefit</U> </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A Member who retires at a Mandatory Retirement Date pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.2 and any other Member who retires after his Normal Retirement Date
pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.1 shall receive his Accrued Benefit as of such date. A Member who retires after Normal Retirement Age may continue to participate in this Plan and accrue additional benefits until retirement in accordance with, and subject
to the limitations of, Section&nbsp;5.1. Further, in no event shall the deferred benefit be less than such Member&#146;s Accrued Benefit would have been had the Member retired at Normal Retirement Age. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5.3 <U>Early Retirement Benefit</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:3px; text-indent:4%;line-Height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A Member who commences employment with the Company prior to January&nbsp;1, 2006 and retires at an Early Retirement Date after completing twenty years of Continuous Service shall receive his Accrued Benefit reduced by
