<FONT SIZE="1"><SUP>&nbsp;1</SUP></FONT><FONT SIZE="2">/</FONT><FONT SIZE="1">2</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> of 1% for each month that commencement of benefits precedes age 57. Each other Member who retires at an
Early Retirement Date shall receive his Accrued Benefit reduced by <FONT SIZE="1"><SUP>&nbsp;1</SUP></FONT><FONT SIZE="2">/</FONT><FONT SIZE="1">2</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> of 1% for each month that commencement of
benefits precedes Normal Retirement Age. </FONT></FONT></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5.4 <U>Benefit Limitations</U> </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) Notwithstanding the provisions of Sections&nbsp;5.1, 5.2, 5.3 and 7.1, in limitation years beginning before January&nbsp;1, 2001, the
annual amount of the retirement benefit, paid in the form of either a single life annuity or a joint and survivor annuity under Section&nbsp;6.2(a), shall not exceed the lesser of (i)&nbsp;$90,000 (as adjusted to reflect increases in the
cost-of-living pursuant to Section&nbsp;415(d) of the Code) or (ii)&nbsp;100% of the average of the Member&#146;s total compensation during 3 consecutive Plan Years in which </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-30- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the Member earned the greatest total compensation. If a Member&#146;s retirement benefit is paid in a form other than a single life annuity or a joint and
survivor annuity under Section&nbsp;6.2(a), the amount thereof, as adjusted as provided in the next sentence, shall not exceed the limitations of this paragraph. The amount of such retirement benefit shall be adjusted to the actuarial equivalent of
a single life annuity based on (i)&nbsp;the actuarial factors and assumptions described in Table A or (ii)&nbsp;the mortality table and interest rate referred to in Section&nbsp;5.7, whichever produces the higher amount. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) If the date of commencement of the Member&#146;s retirement benefit is after the Member&#146;s Social Security Retirement Age, the
$90,000 limitation in (a)&nbsp;above (as adjusted) shall be increased to the equivalent actuarial value thereof beginning at the Social Security Retirement Age. If the date of commencement of the Member&#146;s retirement benefit is prior to the
Member&#146;s 62nd birthday, the $90,000 limitation in (a)&nbsp;above (as adjusted) shall be reduced to the equivalent actuarial value thereof beginning at age 62. Such increase or reduction shall be made using (i)&nbsp;the actuarial factors and
assumptions described in Table A or (ii)&nbsp;the mortality table and interest rate referred to in Section&nbsp;5.7, whichever produces the lower amount. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) If the Member has less than 10 years of participation in the Plan, the $90,000 limitation in (a)&nbsp;above shall be reduced by one-tenth for each year of participation in the Plan (or part thereof) less than 10.
If the Member has less than 10&nbsp;years of Continuous Service, the compensation limitation in (a)&nbsp;above shall be reduced by one-tenth for each year of Continuous Service (or part thereof) less than&nbsp;10. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-31- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d) All defined benefit plans of the Company and any Subsidiary or Affiliate are to be
treated as one defined benefit plan for purposes of this Section, and no Member&#146;s annual retirement benefit is reduced by virtue of transfers of assets to the ESOP. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(e) In the case of a Member whose Accrued Benefit as of December&nbsp;31, 1982 exceeds the maximum annual retirement benefit permitted
under Section&nbsp;415(b) of the Code (as amended by the Tax Equity and Fiscal Responsibility Act of 1982 and effective as of January&nbsp;1, 1983 with respect to the Plan), the limitation of Section&nbsp;415(b) of the Code (regarding
Sections&nbsp;415(b) and (e)&nbsp;of the Code as applied to the Plan) shall equal the Member&#146;s Accrued Benefit determined as of such date. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(f) In the case of a Member whose Accrued Benefit as of December&nbsp;31, 1986 exceeds the maximum annual retirement benefit permitted under Section&nbsp;415(b) of the Code, the limitation of Section&nbsp;415(b) of
the Code (regarding Sections&nbsp;415(b) and (e)&nbsp;of the Code as applied to the Plan) shall equal the Member&#146;s Accrued Benefit determined as of such date. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(g) For purposes of this Section&nbsp;5.4, &#147;Total compensation&#148; shall mean the total of all amounts paid to a Member by the
Company, a Subsidiary or Affiliate (or, if applicable, a Predecessor) for personal services actually rendered during a year, computed prior to any reduction for elective deferrals under any qualified cash or deferred arrangement or cafeteria plan
maintained by the Company or a Subsidiary (or a Predecessor) pursuant to Section&nbsp;401(k) of the Code or Section&nbsp;125 of the Code respectively, and in accordance with Treasury Regulation Section&nbsp;1.415-2(d) and Section </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-32- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">415(c)(3) of the Code and, effective January&nbsp;1, 2001, any qualified transportation fringe benefit plan described in Section&nbsp;132(f) of the Code.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Effective for limitation years ending after December&nbsp;31, 2001: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(h) Benefit increases resulting from the increase in the limitations of Section&nbsp;415(b) of the Code will be provided to all current
and former Members (with benefits limited by Section&nbsp;415(b)) who have an accrued benefit under the Plan immediately prior to the effective date of this Section (other than an accrued benefit resulting from a benefit increase solely as a result
of the increases in limitations under Section&nbsp;415(b)). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In no event will the dollar amount of a Member&#146;s annual retirement
benefit exceed the maximum permissible amount (as defined below). If a Member&#146;s retirement benefit is paid in a form other than a single life annuity or a joint and survivor annuity under Section&nbsp;6.2(a), the amount thereof, as adjusted as
provided in the next sentence, shall not exceed the limitations of this subsection (h). The amount of such retirement benefit shall be adjusted to the actuarial equivalent of a single life annuity based on (i)&nbsp;the actuarial factors and
assumptions described in Table A or (ii)&nbsp;the mortality table and interest rate referred to in Section&nbsp;5.7, whichever produces the higher amount. For purposes of this subsection (h), the following terms shall have the meanings set forth
below: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The &#147;defined benefit dollar limitation&#148; is $160,000, as adjusted, effective January&nbsp;1 of each year, under
Section&nbsp;415(d) of the Code in such manner as the Secretary shall prescribe, and payable in the form of a straight life annuity. A limitation as adjusted </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-33- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">under Section&nbsp;415(d) will apply to limitation years ending with or within the calendar year for which the adjustment applies. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The &#147;defined benefit compensation limitation&#148; is 100% of the Member&#146;s average compensation for the Member&#146;s high 3 years, determined
in accordance with Section&nbsp;415(b) of the Code and the regulations thereunder. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The &#147;maximum permissible benefit&#148; is the
lesser of the defined benefit dollar limitation or the defined benefit compensation limitation both adjusted where required, as provided in (A)&nbsp;and, if applicable, in (B)&nbsp;or (C)&nbsp;below. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:13%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(A) If the Member has fewer than 10 years of participation in the Plan, the defined benefit dollar limitation shall be multiplied by a
fraction, (1)&nbsp;the numerator of which is the number of years (or part thereof) of participation in the Plan and (2)&nbsp;the denominator of which is 10. In the case of a Member who has fewer than 10 years of Credited Service, the defined benefit
compensation limitation shall be multiplied by a fraction, (x)&nbsp;the numerator of which is the number of years (or part thereof) of Credited Service and (y)&nbsp;the denominator of which is 10. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:13%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(B) If the benefit of a Member begins prior to age 62, the defined benefit dollar limitation applicable to the Member at such earlier age
is an annual benefit payable in the form of a straight life annuity beginning at the earlier age that is the Actuarial Equivalent of the defined benefit dollar limitation </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-34- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:13%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">applicable to the Member at age 62 (adjusted under (A)&nbsp;above, if required). The defined benefit dollar limitation applicable at an age prior to age 62
is determined as the lesser of (1)&nbsp;the Actuarial Equivalent (at such age) of the defined benefit dollar limitation computed using the interest rate and mortality table (or other tabular factor) specified in Section&nbsp;5.7 of the Plan and
(2)&nbsp;the Actuarial Equivalent (at such age) of the defined benefit dollar limitation computed using a 5-percent interest rate and the applicable mortality table as specified in Section&nbsp;5.7 of the Plan. Any decrease in the defined benefit
dollar limitation determined in accordance with this paragraph (B)&nbsp;shall not reflect a mortality decrement if benefits are not forfeited upon the death of the Member. If any benefits are forfeited upon death, the full mortality decrement is
taken into account. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:13%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(C) If the benefit of a Member begins after the Member attains age 65, the defined benefit dollar
limitation applicable to the Member at the later age is the annual benefit payable in the form of a straight life annuity beginning at the later age that is actuarially equivalent to the defined benefit dollar limitation applicable to the Member at
age 65 (adjusted under (A)&nbsp;above, if required). The Actuarial Equivalent of the defined benefit dollar limitation applicable at an age after age 65 is determined as (1)&nbsp;the </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-35- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:13%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">lesser of the Actuarial Equivalent (at such age) of the defined benefit dollar limitation computed using the interest rate and mortality table (or other
tabular factor) specified in Section&nbsp;5.7 of the Plan and (2)&nbsp;the Actuarial Equivalent (at such age) of the defined benefit dollar limitation computed using a 5-percent interest rate assumption and the applicable mortality table as
specified in Section&nbsp;5.7 of the Plan. For these purposes, mortality between age 65 and the age at which benefits commence shall be ignored. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">5.5 <U>Offsets and Deductions from Benefits</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In no event shall a benefit payable under the Plan duplicate a benefit payable
with respect to the same service pursuant to the provisions of a Prior Plan or a qualified plan of a Predecessor. The offset for the benefit payable under such other Plan shall be the Actuarial Equivalent of the Accrued Benefit otherwise payable
under this Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5.6 <U>Prohibition on Reduction in Benefits</U> </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In no event shall the Accrued Benefit payable in respect of, a Member who was a member or participant under a Prior Plan be less than his accrued benefit
under such Prior Plan immediately prior to its merger into this Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5.7 <U>Lump Sum Payment in Full Discharge of Benefits</U>
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If the present value of the benefits of a Member who retires or terminates employment with a right to a vested benefit does not exceed
$1,000, or the present value of the benefits payable to a beneficiary or alternate payee, as applicable, does not exceed </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-36- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">$1,000 at the time such benefits become payable, such Member, beneficiary or alternate payee (each a &#147;Payee&#148;) shall be paid such present value in
cash in a lump sum as soon as practicable thereafter in full satisfaction of the Payee&#146;s benefits under the Plan. Such present value shall be equal to the Actuarial Equivalent of the Payee&#146;s benefits as determined using (i)&nbsp;the
applicable mortality table prescribed by the Secretary of the Treasury (or a delegate thereof) pursuant to Section&nbsp;417(e)(3)(A) of the Code and (ii)&nbsp;the applicable interest rate, which is the annual interest rate on 30-year Treasury
securities as specified by the Secretary of the Treasury (or a delegate thereof) pursuant to Section&nbsp;417(e)(3)(A) of the Code for the prior calendar month preceding the first day of the month during which the payment is made. (Accordingly, the
&#147;stability period&#148; is one calendar month.) Notwithstanding anything contained herein to the contrary, in no event shall such present value be less than the Actuarial Equivalent of the Payee&#146;s Accrued Benefit as of June&nbsp;30, 1995
under the terms of the Plan as then in effect. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE VI. <U>Payment of Retirement Benefits.</U> </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.1 <U>Normal Form</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Except as provided in
Section&nbsp;6.2, a Member&#146;s normal form of retirement benefit shall be an income payable monthly for life and terminating with the payment preceding his death. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.2 <U>Alternate Normal Form</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If a Member retires on or after he reaches age 55 and is married on such
date, unless he shall have elected otherwise in writing during the period specified below, his </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-37- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">benefits shall be paid in the alternate normal form in accordance with the following provisions: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) The alternate normal form shall consist of a joint-and-survivor annuity which is the Actuarial Equivalent of the normal form of
retirement income provided under Section&nbsp;6.1, payable in monthly installments during the life of the Member and thereafter during the life of his spouse (if his spouse shall then be living) in an amount equal to 50% of the reduced installments
payable during his life. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) At least 90&nbsp;days prior to the commencement of the election period described in
paragraph&nbsp;(c) below, the Committee shall furnish to him in writing, a nontechnical explanation of the terms and conditions of the alternate normal form and the effect of his revoking or continuing it, including a statement, in terms of dollars
per annuity payment, of the financial effect of receiving benefits in the alternate normal form. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) On a form prescribed
by the Committee, a Member, otherwise eligible to receive benefits in the alternate normal form, may, with the written consent of his spouse, elect not to receive benefits in such form in which case benefits will be paid as provided in
Section&nbsp;6.1 or, if elected and if the Member qualifies therefor, in an optional form described in Section&nbsp;6.3. An election not to receive the alternate normal form must be filed no later than the later of: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) 30&nbsp;days prior to the date that retirement benefits are to commence; or </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-38- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) the end of the 90-day period commencing on the date on which the Committee provides
the information described in subsection&nbsp;6.2(b). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">An election not to receive benefits in the alternate normal form may be revoked by
filing a written revocation with the Committee within the election period described in paragraph (c)&nbsp;above. Notwithstanding any other provisions of this Plan to the contrary, in the event that a Member dies within 30 days prior to retirement,
his benefits will be paid in accordance with Section&nbsp;7.1. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d) Notwithstanding the foregoing (but subject to the last
sentence of subsection (c)&nbsp;above) the Committee may provide the notice described in subsection (b)&nbsp;above less than 30 days before the date retirement benefits are to commence (the &#147;annuity starting date&#148;), provided that the
following requirements are met: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) the Committee provides information to the Member indicating that the Member has a right
to at least 30 days to consider whether to waive the alternate normal form and consent to a form of distribution other than the alternate normal form; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) the Member is permitted to revoke an affirmative distribution election at least until the annuity starting date or, if later, at any time prior to the expiration of the 7-day period that begins the day after the
explanation of the alternate normal form is provided to the Member; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-39- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iii) the annuity starting date is after the date that the explanation of the alternate
normal form is provided to the Member; and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iv) distribution in accordance with the affirmative election does not commence
before the expiration of the 7-day period that begins the day after the explanation of the alternate normal form is provided to the Member. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(e) The alternate normal form shall not be payable to the surviving spouse of the Member unless the Member shall have been married to such spouse during the one-year period ending on the date of the Member&#146;s
death. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.3 <U>Optional Forms</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">(a) In lieu of the normal form or alternate normal form of retirement benefit, a Member may elect at any time at least thirty days prior to his retirement under Sections&nbsp;4.1, 4.2 and 4.3, provided the Member&#146;s spouse, if any,
consents in writing to such election, to receive an optional form of settlement that is the Actuarial Equivalent of the normal form of benefit under Section&nbsp;6.1 (and to any beneficiary designated to thereunder) in one of the following forms:
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Option&nbsp;1</U>: A reduced benefit payable during his life with the provision that it shall continue after his death either
(i)&nbsp;at the same ratio or (ii)&nbsp;at two-thirds of the rate payable during his life for the life of his spouse, should such spouse survive him. If such spouse should predecease the Member, payment of benefits under this Option shall cease upon
the Member&#146;s death. The Member shall elect the rate at which the surviving spouse shall receive payment. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-40- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Option&nbsp;2</U>: A benefit payable monthly for his life with either (i)&nbsp;60 or
(ii)&nbsp;120&nbsp;payments guaranteed, with payments to continue to a beneficiary designated by him (or if the beneficiary should predecease the Member, to the Member&#146;s estate) should the Member die prior to the expiration of the guarantee
period. The Member shall elect which guarantee period shall apply. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Option&nbsp;3</U>: A Member who retires before he is eligible to
apply for benefits under the Social Security Act may elect to receive any benefit adjusted in such manner that the total monthly amount received by the Member from the Plan and, when he becomes eligible therefor, from Social Security, will be
approximately the same both before and after the time when the Member begins to receive such Social Security benefits. For the purpose of this option, Social Security benefits shall be taken at the amount of primary benefits which the Member would
receive when first eligible for such benefits. A Member may also elect this Option&nbsp;3 in conjunction with Option&nbsp;1 or Option&nbsp;2. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2"><U>Option&nbsp;4</U>: Prior to November&nbsp;10, 1981, any Member who remains in service after he first becomes eligible to retire under Section&nbsp;4.1 above may, at any time at least thirty days prior to his retirement or death, elect to
receive, in lieu of the benefit to which he would be entitled at the time of his retirement or at the time of his death if he were considered to retire at that time, an optional form of settlement which is the Actuarial Equivalent of the Normal Form
of benefit (under the applicable terms of the Plan in effect for such option) (computed on the basis of his number of years of Credited Service prior to, and his Average Final Compensation immediately preceding the date of this election) under one
of the Options of this Section&nbsp;6.3, such optional benefit to commence </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-41- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">or be payable at his retirement or death, whichever is earlier. In the event of the death of the Member after effectively making this election, payment will
be made to a beneficiary designated by him as though such Member had retired immediately prior to the date of his death. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">An election under
this Option&nbsp;4 shall be irrevocable and in lieu of any other election under Section&nbsp;6.3, and in lieu of the benefit provided in Section&nbsp;4.1. If the Member&#146;s designated beneficiary predeceases the Member whether before or after the
Member&#146;s retirement, the election shall remain in effect and the rate and amount of payments to which the Member is entitled will remain unchanged and will cease upon his death; provided, however, that the Member may change the designation of
the Option described in this Section&nbsp;6.3 payable pursuant to his election under this Option&nbsp;4 and any designation of beneficiary made by him pursuant to Section&nbsp;6.4 at any time at least thirty days prior to his retirement. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On or after November&nbsp;10, 1981, a Member may not select Option&nbsp;4. Any Member in service as of such date who previously made an irrevocable
election under the preceding paragraph may make a one-time election, at any time at least thirty days prior to his retirement, to receive his Accrued Benefit under any Option permitted under Article VI without regard to his previous irrevocable
election. If any Member entitled to make an election under this paragraph fails to do so, he will receive his Accrued Benefit, determined as of the date of his irrevocable election, in accordance with such irrevocable election. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-42- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Option&nbsp;5</U>: For Members who commenced employment with a Contributing Company prior to
January&nbsp;1, 2006, a single lump-sum payment of the Actuarial Equivalent of a Member&#146;s Accrued Benefit determined using (i)&nbsp;the applicable mortality table prescribed by the Secretary of the Treasury (or a delegate thereof) pursuant to
Section&nbsp;417(e)(3)(A) of the Code and (ii)&nbsp;applicable interest rate, which is the annual interest rate on 30-year Treasury securities as specified by the Secretary of the Treasury (or a delegate thereof) pursuant to
Section&nbsp;417(e)(3)(A) of the Code for the prior calendar month preceding the first day of the month during which the payment is made. (Accordingly, the &#147;stability period&#148; is one calendar month.) Notwithstanding anything contained
herein to the contrary, in no event shall such lump-sum payment be less than the equivalent actuarial value of the Member&#146;s Accrued Benefit as of June&nbsp;30, 1995 under the terms of the Plan as then in effect. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Notwithstanding anything contained herein to the contrary, a Member who was an Employee at the time of the Member&#146;s retirement and who had an hour
of Credited Service on or after January&nbsp;1, 2005, may elect at any time at least sixty days prior to the Member&#146;s retirement under Sections&nbsp;4.1, 4.2 and 4.3 to receive an optional form of settlement, of which is the Actuarial
Equivalent of the benefits the Member would receive under the normal form under Section&nbsp;6.1, in the form of a reduced benefit payable during the Member&#146;s life with the provision that it shall continue after the Member&#146;s death either
(i)&nbsp;at the same rate, (ii)&nbsp;at two-thirds of the rate payable during the Member&#146;s life for the life of the Member&#146;s domestic partner, should such domestic partner survive the Member, or (iii)&nbsp;at 50% of the rate payable during
the life of the Member for the life </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-43- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">of the Member&#146;s domestic partner, should such domestic partner survive the Member. If such domestic partner should predecease the Member, payment of the
benefits under this Option shall cease upon the Member&#146;s death. The Member shall elect the rate at which the domestic partner shall receive payment. For purposes of this paragraph, &#147;domestic partner&#148; shall have the meaning ascribed to
such term (A)&nbsp;under Chapter&nbsp;12B.1 of the San Francisco, California Administrative Code, (B)&nbsp;under other applicable law, or (C)&nbsp;by the Company generally to mean a person (who is at least 18 years of age) to whom a Member (who is
at least 18 years of age) is not legally married (and who is not legally married to someone else), to whom the Member is not related by blood, with whom the Member shares a principal residence, and with whom the Member is in a relationship that is
intended to be both permanent and one in which each is the sole domestic partner of the other, provided such Member signs a confirmation (in a form acceptable to the Company) affirming his status and, provided, further, that the Member promptly
notifies the Company of any change in such status. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) No election under this Section&nbsp;6.3 shall become effective if the Member, and
in the case of an election under Option 1, the Member&#146;s spouse, shall die prior to the time the Member commences to receive benefits. However, if a Member dies within thirty days of the date his retirement benefits commence, any election made
by him under this Section&nbsp;6.3 prior to his death shall become effective and irrevocable. Further, if the Member shall die within the 30&nbsp;days preceding retirement, the benefit payable to his spouse under the option shall not be less than
the benefit provided under Article&nbsp;V. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-44- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) The payments to be made under this Plan shall satisfy the requirements of the Regulations in
&#167;1.401(a)(9)&#150;2 with respect to minimum incidental benefits. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d) Notwithstanding the foregoing, an election of an optional form
of benefit as permitted under the terms of the Plan in effect on December&nbsp;31, 1983 shall be effective if it is made prior to January&nbsp;1, 1984 and is not changed or revoked subsequent to December&nbsp;31, 1983. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.4 <U>Designation of Beneficiary</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Where
this Plan provides for the designation of a beneficiary, the Member shall make such designation and shall be entitled to revoke or change such designation (with the consent of his spouse if he is married) in writing on a form provided by the
Committee filed no later than thirty days prior to retirement or, in the case of a benefit under Section&nbsp;9.1, thirty days prior to his Normal Retirement Date, or at the date his benefits commence, if earlier. No designation may be made,
revoked, or changed after that time except under Option&nbsp;2. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.5 <U>Time of Distribution</U> </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Distribution of benefits shall commence no later than 60&nbsp;days after the close of the Plan Year in which the latest of the following events shall
occur: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) the Member attains his Normal Retirement Age; </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) the 10th anniversary of the date on which the Member commenced participation in the Plan; </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) the date the Member terminates employment; or </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-45- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d) the date specified in a written election by the Member to have benefits commence at a
date later than otherwise required by this Section. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:3px; text-indent:4%;line-Height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Notwithstanding any other provision of the Plan to
the contrary, payment of the retirement benefit of a Member who (i)&nbsp;is a 5-percent owner (within the meaning of Section&nbsp;416(i)(1)(B) of the Code) of the Company or any Affiliate at any time during the Plan Year ending in the calendar year
in which the Member attains age 70<FONT SIZE="1"><SUP>&nbsp;1</SUP></FONT><FONT SIZE="2">/</FONT><FONT SIZE="1">2</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> and (ii)&nbsp;continues as an Employee after the calendar year in which he
attains age&nbsp;70<FONT SIZE="1"><SUP>&nbsp;1</SUP></FONT><FONT SIZE="2">/</FONT><FONT SIZE="1">2</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> shall commence no later than April&nbsp;1 of the calendar year following the calendar
year in which he attains age&nbsp;70<FONT SIZE="1"><SUP>&nbsp;1</SUP></FONT><FONT SIZE="2">/</FONT><FONT SIZE="1">2</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> (the &#147;Required Beginning Date&#148;); provided, however, that if
the Member has not made a timely election of an optional form of benefit pursuant to Section&nbsp;6.3, his retirement benefit shall be paid in the normal form or alternate normal form pursuant to Sections&nbsp;6.1 and 6.2. In the event that a Member
whose retirement benefit has commenced in accordance with the preceding sentence retires within 12&nbsp;months after the commencement of his benefit or any anniversary of such April&nbsp;1, his retirement benefit shall be redetermined as of his
actual retirement date. In the event that such Member is not retired as of any anniversary of the commencement of his benefit, his retirement benefit shall be redetermined to take into account any increase therein since his Required Beginning Date.
</FONT></FONT></FONT></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:3px; text-indent:4%;line-Height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Payment of the retirement benefit of a Member who (i)&nbsp;continues in
employment after the calendar year in which he attains age&nbsp;70<FONT SIZE="1"><SUP>&nbsp;1</SUP></FONT><FONT SIZE="2">/</FONT><FONT SIZE="1">2</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> and (ii)&nbsp;was not a 5-percent owner of
the Company or any Affiliate at any time during the calendar year in which the Member attains age&nbsp;70<FONT SIZE="1"><SUP>&nbsp;1</SUP></FONT><FONT SIZE="2">/</FONT><FONT SIZE="1">2</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">
shall commence no later than April&nbsp;1 of the calendar year following the </FONT></FONT></FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-46- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:3px;line-Height:95%; vertical-align:top">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">calendar year in which the Member&#146;s employment terminates in accordance with the applicable provisions of Sections&nbsp;6.1, 6.2 and 6.3; provided,
however, that such Member will be permitted to elect any optional form of benefit under Section&nbsp;6.3 that would have been available if the Member had terminated employment in the calendar year in which the Member attained age&nbsp;70<FONT
SIZE="1"><SUP>&nbsp;1</SUP></FONT><FONT SIZE="2">/</FONT><FONT SIZE="1">2</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">. In addition, the retirement benefit of a Member referred to in the preceding sentence shall be actuarially
increased to take into account the period (the &#147;Deferral Period&#148;) from April&nbsp;1 of the calendar year following the calendar year in which the Member attained age&nbsp;70<FONT SIZE="1"><SUP>&nbsp;1</SUP></FONT><FONT
SIZE="2">/</FONT><FONT SIZE="1">2</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> to the date on which benefits payments commence by (i)&nbsp;adjusting the Member&#146;s retirement benefit on the date payment commences (without regard
to any additional accruals during the Deferral Period) to be Actuarial Equivalent to the Member&#146;s retirement benefit at the beginning of the Deferral Period; and (ii)&nbsp;adjusting any additional retirement benefits accrued during the Deferral
Period, after reduction for the increase in the amount of the Member&#146;s retirement benefit provided in clause&nbsp;(i), so that the amount thereof on the date payment commences is the Actuarial Equivalent of the benefit payable at the beginning
of the Deferral Period. </FONT></FONT></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:3px; text-indent:4%;line-Height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The provisions of the preceding two paragraphs apply to Members
who attain age&nbsp;70<FONT SIZE="1"><SUP>&nbsp;1</SUP></FONT><FONT SIZE="2">/</FONT><FONT SIZE="1">2</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> after December&nbsp;31, 1999; the provisions of the second paragraph of this
Section&nbsp;as in effect prior to January&nbsp;1, 2000 shall continue to apply to Members who attained age&nbsp;70<FONT SIZE="1"><SUP>&nbsp;1</SUP></FONT><FONT SIZE="2">/</FONT><FONT SIZE="1">2</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"
COLOR="#000000"> prior to January&nbsp;1, 2000. </FONT></FONT></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.6 <U>Effect of Re-Employment</U> </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If a Member who is receiving benefits under Section&nbsp;5.1, 5.3, 9.1 or 9.2 resumes employment with the Company or any Affiliate, his benefit payments
shall be continued </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-47- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">in the same amount and in the same form. Upon subsequent retirement or termination of employment, such Member shall be entitled to receive a revised
retirement benefit taking into account the Member&#146;s Credited Service and Compensation during such resumption of employment. In determining such Member&#146;s revised benefit under Section&nbsp;5.1(a) (if applicable), if the Member was a
Full-Time Employee at the time of his retirement or termination of employment and resumes employment as a Part-Time Employee, his Compensation for each year of Credited Service (or part thereof) during the period of his resumption of employment
shall be deemed to be equal to the product of (i)&nbsp;the Member&#146;s hourly wage rate multiplied by the number of hours per calendar month regularly scheduled to be worked by a similarly situated Full-Time Employee, (ii)&nbsp;a fraction, the
numerator of which is the average of the number of Hours of Service credited to the Member in each calendar month during each such year of Credited Service (or part thereof), and the denominator of which is the number of hours per calendar month
regularly scheduled to be worked by a similarly situated regular Full-Time Employee during each such year of Credited Service (or part thereof) and (iii)&nbsp;the number of calendar months during each such year of Credited Service in which the
Member has been credited with one or more Hours of Service. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following provisions shall apply to any Member reemployed on or after
January&nbsp;1, 2006: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) Such Member&#146;s benefit under Section&nbsp;5.1(b) shall be determined based on his actual
Compensation during the period of his resumption of employment and, if applicable, any period of initial employment on or after January&nbsp;1, 2006. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-48- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) If such Member initially commenced employment with a Contributing Company prior to
January&nbsp;1, 2006 and did not forfeit or receive a distribution of his prior Accrued Benefit, the Indexation Factor provided by Section&nbsp;5.1(a)(iii) shall be applied based on Continuous Service commencing on his reemployment date and, if
applicable, any other period of Continuous Service beginning on or after January&nbsp;1, 2006 and completed prior to his initial termination of employment. Such Member shall be eligible to qualify for early retirement benefits under the first
sentence of Section&nbsp;5.3, and shall be eligible to elect Option 5 as an optional form of payment in accordance with Section&nbsp;6.3(a). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) If such Member terminated employment with a Contributing Company on or after January&nbsp;1, 2006 and received a distribution of his prior Accrued Benefit, such Member&#146;s years of Credited Service will be
capped at 40 less the number of years of Credited Service taken into account in determining such prior Accrued Benefit. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.7 <U>Direct
Rollover Payments</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) This Section&nbsp;6.7 applies to distributions made on or after January&nbsp;1, 1993. Notwithstanding any
provision of the Plan to the contrary that would otherwise limit a distributee&#146;s election under this subsection, a distributee may elect, at the time and in the manner prescribed by the Committee, to have any portion of an eligible rollover
distribution paid directly to an eligible retirement plan specified by the distributee in a direct rollover. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) For purposes of this
Section&nbsp;6.7, the following terms shall have the meanings set forth below: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-49- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) <U>Eligible rollover distribution</U>: An eligible rollover distribution is any
distribution of all or any portion of the balance to the credit of the distributee, except that an eligible rollover distribution does not include: any distribution that is one of a series of substantially equal periodic payments (not less
frequently than annually) made for the life (or life expectancy) of the distributee or the joint lives (or joint life expectancies) of the distributee and for distributee&#146;s designated beneficiary, or for a specified period of ten years or more;
any distribution to the extent such distribution is required under Section&nbsp;401(a)(9) of the Code; and the portion of any distribution prior to January&nbsp;1, 2002 that is not includible in gross income (determined without regard to the
exclusion for net unrealized appreciation with respect to employer securities). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) <U>Eligible retirement plan</U>: An
eligible retirement plan is an individual retirement account described in Section&nbsp;408(a) of the Code, an individual retirement annuity described in Section&nbsp;408(b) of the Code (other than an endowment contract), an annuity plan described in
Section&nbsp;403(a) of the Code, a qualified trust described in Section&nbsp;401(a) of the Code, that accepts the distributee&#146;s eligible rollover distribution. However, in the case of an eligible rollover distribution to the surviving spouse,
an eligible retirement plan is an individual retirement account or individual retirement annuity. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-50- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iii) <U>Distributee</U>: A distributee includes an Employee or former Employee. In
addition, the Employee&#146;s or former Employee&#146;s surviving spouse and the Employee&#146;s or former Employee&#146;s spouse or former spouse who is the alternate payee under a qualified domestic relations order, as defined in
Section&nbsp;414(p) of the Code, are distributees with regard to the interest of the spouse or former spouse. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iv)
<U>Direct rollover</U>: A direct rollover is a payment by the Plan to the eligible retirement plan specified by the distributee. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">Notwithstanding the foregoing, but for distributions made under the Plan after December&nbsp;31, 2001, for purposes of the direct rollover provisions of this Section, an eligible retirement plan shall also mean an annuity contract described
in Section&nbsp;403(b) of the Code and an eligible plan under Section&nbsp;457(b) of the Code which is maintained by a state, political subdivision of a state, or any agency or instrumentality of a state or political subdivision of a state and which
agrees to separately account for amounts transferred into such plan from this Plan. The definition of eligible retirement plan shall also apply in the case of a distribution to a surviving spouse, or to a spouse or former spouse who is the alternate
payee under a qualified domestic relation order, as defined in Section&nbsp;414(p) of the Code. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE VII. <U>Spouse&#146;s Death Benefit.</U>
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7.1 In the event of the death of (a)&nbsp;a Member in active service prior to his retirement and after he has (i)&nbsp;attained age fifty
and completed ten years of Credited Service, (ii)&nbsp;attained age fifty-five, (iii)&nbsp;completed twenty-five years of Continuous </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-51- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Service or (iv)&nbsp;reached an age and completed a number of years of Continuous Service, the sum of which is at least sixty-five, or (b)&nbsp;a Member
(A)&nbsp;who retires on an Early Retirement Date or on or after the Member&#146;s Normal Retirement Date and (B)&nbsp;whose death occurs prior to the commencement of the Member&#146;s retirement benefit, a benefit shall be paid to the surviving
spouse of such Member commencing on the required beginning date for such spousal benefit under Section&nbsp;401(a)(9) of the Code or such earlier date as may be elected by the surviving spouse in the manner prescribed by the Committee, provided that
such Member has been legally married to such spouse for at least one year prior to the Member&#146;s death. The annual amount of such benefit shall be 100% of the benefit the Member would have received had he retired on the date of death and elected
Option&nbsp;1(i) of Section&nbsp;6.3 with the surviving spouse as his beneficiary. However, no early retirement reduction factor will be applied. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">In the event of the death of (a)&nbsp;a Member in active service who has completed 10&nbsp;years of Continuous Service but before he has attained age&nbsp;50 or completed 10&nbsp;years of Credited Service, or (b)&nbsp;a Member who has
terminated employment, is entitled to a vested benefit under Article&nbsp;IX, and dies before payment of such benefit commences, and such Member is survived by a spouse to whom he has been legally married for at least one year prior to the
Member&#146;s death, a benefit shall be paid to such spouse commencing on the required beginning date for such spousal benefit under Section&nbsp;401(a)(9) of the Code or such earlier date as may be elected by the surviving spouse in the manner
prescribed by the Committee. The annual amount of such benefit shall be the amount the </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-52- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">spouse would have received under the alternate normal form under Section&nbsp;6.2 if the Member&#146;s benefit had commenced on such date. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For purposes of this Section, a Member who is eligible to receive benefits under the Company&#146;s long-term disability plan or the long-term disability
plan of an affiliate and is accruing Credited Service pursuant to Section&nbsp;2.3 at the time of his death shall be treated as a Member in active service. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:3px; text-indent:4%;line-Height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For purposes of this Article&nbsp;VII, (i)&nbsp;the domestic partner (as such term is defined in Section&nbsp;6.3(a))
of a Member who was an Employee at the time of the Member&#146;s death and who had an hour of Credited Service on or after January&nbsp;1, 2005, shall be treated as the spouse of the Member and (ii)&nbsp;the Member and such domestic partner shall be
treated as having been legally married for at least one year prior to the Member&#146;s death if they have met the requirements for domestic partner status (as defined in Section&nbsp;6.3(a)) during such one-year period. Benefits payable to a
domestic partner pursuant to this paragraph shall commence no later than the latest commencement date for such benefits permitted by Section&nbsp;401(a)(9) of the Code, even if such date is prior to the Member&#146;s 55</FONT><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#000000"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> birthday. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7.2
The spouse or domestic partner (as such term is defined in Section&nbsp;6.3(a)) of a Member who is entitled to receive a benefit pursuant to the first paragraph of Section&nbsp;7.1 may elect to receive a lump sum which is the Actuarial Equivalent of
the benefit otherwise payable, calculated using the same factors as are utilized in Section&nbsp;5.7. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-53- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE VIII. <U>Contributions.</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.1 <U>By Contributing Company</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) Each Contributing Company shall pay to the Trustee the amounts
actuarially required to provide the benefits for its Employees covered under the Plan. No contribution shall be required of Members. Each contribution by a Contributing Company is made on the express condition that the contribution is deductible
under Section&nbsp;404 of the Code. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) All expenses of the administration of the Plan shall be borne by the Contributing Companies, and
the Company shall apportion such expenses among the Contributing Companies. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) Forfeitures due to the termination of employment of
Members while not entitled to any benefits under the Plan shall be applied to reduce contributions of the Contributing Companies in subsequent years. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.2 <U>No Member Contributions</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This Plan does not require or permit Member contributions. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE IX. <U>Vesting Upon Termination of Employment.</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">9.1 <U>Upon Termination After Completion of Five Years of Continuous Service</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If the employment of a Member who is an Employee
on or after January&nbsp;1, 1989 is terminated prior to qualifying for any early or other retirement benefits under the Plan after he has completed five years of Continuous Service or attained age 55, he shall be entitled to receive a deferred
retirement benefit equal to his Accrued Benefit, payable in accordance with Section&nbsp;6.1, Section&nbsp;6.2 or Section&nbsp;6.3, whichever is applicable, and </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-54- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">commencing on the Member&#146;s required beginning date under Section&nbsp;401(a)(9) of the Code or such earlier date as the Member may elect in the manner
prescribed by the Committee. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the event of the disposition by the Company or a Subsidiary to an unrelated purchaser of all or
substantially all of the stock or other equity interests in a Former Affiliate (as such term is defined in Section&nbsp;4.4) to an unrelated purchaser or any other employer which is a member of the same controlled group of corporations as the
unrelated purchaser or is a trade or business under common control with the unrelated purchaser, (and unless related assets and liabilities of the Plan will be transferred to another defined benefit plan), a Member employed by such Former Affiliate
at the time of such disposition shall be deemed to have terminated employment for purposes of Article IX if, pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.4, the Member could have retired for purposes of Section&nbsp;4.1 and 4.3 had the Member attained Normal
Retirement Age or age fifty-five. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">9.2 <U>Early Payment of Vested Benefits</U> </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:3px; text-indent:4%;line-Height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Notwithstanding the above provisions of this Article&nbsp;IX, the Committee upon receipt of an application for
benefits subsequent to the Member&#146;s termination of employment but prior to his Normal Retirement Age will commence payment of any benefit payable in accordance with Section&nbsp;9.1 as of the first day of any month coinciding with or following
the date on which the Member attains age 55 subject to an actuarial reduction of <FONT SIZE="1"><SUP>&nbsp;1</SUP></FONT><FONT SIZE="2">/</FONT><FONT SIZE="1">2</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> of 1% for each month by
which commencement of benefit precedes the Member&#146;s Normal Retirement Age. </FONT></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-55- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE X. <U>Administration of the Plan.</U> </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">10.1 The Plan shall be administered by a Committee which shall consist of three members holding the positions set forth in Section&nbsp;10.2 below, who
shall serve without compensation and hold office solely to the extent that they hold such positions. The Committee shall also serve as the &#147;Named Fiduciary&#148; within the meaning of Section&nbsp;402(a) of ERISA, for other purposes for which
it is granted authority under this Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">10.2 A member of the Committee shall be deemed to have been appointed to the Committee upon
assuming a position listed below, and shall be deemed to have resigned from such position upon termination of employment or assuming a position not listed below. The job functions conferring automatic membership in the Committee are the following:
(a)&nbsp;the Chief Trust Officer of The Bank of New York; (b)&nbsp;the Head of Investment Research of The Bank of New York; and (c)&nbsp;the Head of Benefits Planning of The Bank of New York. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">10.3 The Committee, or its Chairman, subject to approval by the Committee, may appoint a Standing Committee of at least three members who, if they are
not members of the Committee, shall not be Section&nbsp;16 Persons or other employees likely to have access to material inside information, and shall delegate in writing to the Standing Committee such of its own duties as it may determine. The
Standing Committee, if appointed, shall be required to report periodically, but not less frequently than annually, to the Committee. Appointments to the Standing Committee shall be made and accepted in writing, and resignations or removals from the
Standing Committee shall be made in writing. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-56- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">10.4 The Committee shall hold meetings upon such notice, at such places and at times as it may determine.
A majority of the members of the Committee shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business. All resolutions or other action taken by the Committee may be made either by the vote of a majority of those present at a meeting or in a document
signed by all the members at the time in office without a meeting. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">10.5 The members of the Committee shall elect from their number a
Chairman, shall appoint a Secretary who may, but need not, be one of the members of the Committee, may appoint from their number such committees with such powers as they shall determine, may authorize one or more of their number or any agent to
execute or deliver any instrument in their behalf, and may employ counsel and agents and such clerical and medical services as they may require in carrying out the provisions of the Plan. Subject to the limitations hereof, the Committee shall from
time to time establish rules for the administration of the Plan and the transaction of its business. The Committee shall also employ an independent public accountant and an actuary who shall be responsible respectively for (a)&nbsp;the audit and
review of financial statements of the Plan and (b)&nbsp;the preparation of actuarial statements and material required by ERISA. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">10.6 The
Committee shall maintain accounts showing the fiscal transactions of the Plan and shall keep in convenient form such data as may be necessary for valuations of the assets and liabilities of the Trust Fund. The Committee shall prepare annually a
report showing the assets and liabilities of the Trust Fund as of the close of the Plan Year and giving a brief account of the operation of the Plan for such year. The </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-57- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Committee shall cause to be prepared each year an actuarial report showing the recommended amount of contributions required to fund the benefits for that
year allocated to show the amount required from each Contributing Company to adequately fund the benefits for its Employees. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">10.7 The
Committee shall have authority to interpret the provisions hereof, correct errors, resolve ambiguities and remedy inconsistencies or omissions. The determination by the Committee of any disputed questions hereunder shall be final and conclusive.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">10.8 The Company will indemnify and save harmless each member of the Committee and, if appointed, the Standing Committee, against any
cost, expense or liability, including his attorneys&#146; fees and any sum paid in settlement of any claim with the approval of the Company arising out of any act or omission to act as a member of the Committee or Standing Committee, except for his
own willful misconduct or lack of good faith. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">10.9 In case the claim of any Member or beneficiary for benefits under the Plan is denied,
the Committee shall provide within 90 days of receipt of such written claim (or within 180&nbsp;days, if special circumstances require an extension of time and written notice of the extension is given to the Member or beneficiary within 90&nbsp;days
after receiving the claim for benefits), adequate notice in writing to such claimant, in a manner calculated to be understood by the claimant, setting forth the specific reasons for such denial. The Committee shall afford a Member or beneficiary,
whose claim for benefits has been denied, 60 days from the date notice of such denial is delivered or mailed in </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-58- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">which to appeal the decision in writing to the Committee. If the Member or beneficiary appeals the decision in writing within 60 days, the Committee shall
review the written comments and any submissions of the Member or beneficiary and render its decision regarding the appeal within 60 days of receipt of such appeal (or within 120&nbsp;days, if special circumstances require an extension of time and
written notice of the extension is given to the Member or beneficiary within 60&nbsp;days after receiving the claim for benefits). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE XI.
<U>Management of Trust Fund.</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">11.1 The funds of the Plan shall be held in the Trust Fund by the Trustee in accordance with the
provisions of the Trust Indenture, and shall be applied to pay benefits under this Plan. Payments from the Trust Fund shall be made by the Trustee only upon the direction of the Committee or its appointee. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">11.2 All expenses incurred in the administration of the Plan and the Trust Fund shall be paid from the Trust Fund to the extent not paid by the Company.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">11.3 All assets held in the trust of the Prior Plan, including assets held for the benefit of retired employees and employees who
otherwise terminated their employment while entitled to a benefit under the replaced plan, and their beneficiaries, shall be transferred to the Trust Fund. The Trustee shall then make payment from the Trust Fund of benefits to such persons, pursuant
to the terms of the replaced plan. The Trustee shall also make payments from the Trust Fund of amounts required to be paid under Section&nbsp;5.6(b) of this Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">11.4 No part of the corpus or income of the Trust Fund shall be used for, or diverted to, purposes other than for the exclusive benefit of Members, spouses and </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-59- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">beneficiaries of Members entitled to benefits under the Plan (and other persons entitled to benefits under any Prior Plan) and the payment of the expenses of
administering the Plan and the Trust Fund prior to the satisfaction of all liabilities with respect to such Members, spouses, beneficiaries (and other persons). No person shall have any interest in or right to any part of the corpus or income of the
Trust Fund except as and to the extent expressly provided in the Plan and the Trust Indenture, and except as provided under the Code and Title IV of ERISA, the Contributing Companies shall have no liability for the payment of benefits under the
Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE XII. <U>Transitional Provisions.</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">12.1 The Plan shall become effective for each Subsidiary at the time designated in the approval pursuant to Section&nbsp;1.10 given by the Head of Human Resources of The Bank of New York. When such approval is given, the Plan shall be
deemed to have become effective for such Subsidiary for all purposes retroactive to the applicable effective date. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">12.2 Any Member whose
employment shall terminate under the provisions of a Prior Plan on or after the Effective Date but before the merger effective date shall receive the benefit to which he would be entitled under the Plan, appropriately adjusted to reflect the form of
settlement applicable under such Prior Plan. Upon the request of any such Member made within sixty days after the date of effectiveness, however, the Committee may, in its discretion, permit the payment of benefits provided in the Plan, under any
optional form of settlement thereunder. Any such benefit payable </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-60- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">under the Plan for the period preceding the date of effectiveness shall be reduced by the amounts paid under the provisions of such Prior Plan. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">12.3 Any Prior Plan shall remain in effect for purposes of determining benefits to which its members, whose employment terminated for any reason
before the merger effective date, shall be entitled. Such plan may be amended in respect of such persons from time to time in accordance with the provisions thereof; provided, however, that any such amendment shall require the approval of the Board
of Directors of the Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE XIII. <U>Amendment or Termination of Plan.</U> </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">13.1 <U>Amendment</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The provisions of the
Plan may be amended in any respect at any time by the Board of Directors of the Company provided that no such amendment shall retroactively reduce the previously Accrued Benefit of any Member or his beneficiary in violation of Section&nbsp;411(d)(6)
of the Code. Further, no such amendment shall make it possible for any part of the Trust Fund to be used for purposes other than for the exclusive benefit of Members, spouses, and beneficiaries of Members entitled to benefits under the Plan and
persons entitled to benefits under any Prior Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">13.2 <U>Termination or Discontinuance of Contributions</U> </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) Each Contributing Company reserves the right to terminate its participation in the Plan at any time. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) Upon such termination, or any partial termination, of the Plan hereunder, then, subject to the provisions of Section&nbsp;13.3, the rights of all
affected </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-61- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
