<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Members, spouses, and beneficiaries of Members having an interest in the Trust Fund at the effective date of such termination or partial termination, accrued
to the date of such termination or partial termination, shall be nonforfeitable; and the Committee shall allocate the assets of the Plan available to provide benefits among such Members, spouses and beneficiaries of Members, to the extent funded, in
the manner prescribed by Section&nbsp;4044 of ERISA (or corresponding provision of any subsequent applicable law in effect at the time). Notwithstanding the preceding sentence, Members&#146; claims will be limited to plan assets and, if greater,
amounts guaranteed by the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation. After such allocation has been made, any residual assets of the Plan may be distributed to the Company if all liabilities of the Plan to Members, spouses and beneficiaries of Members
have been satisfied and the distribution does not contravene any applicable provision of law. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">13.3 <U>Certain Termination Restrictions</U>
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) Notwithstanding any other provisions contained in the Plan, in the event of the termination of the Plan, the retirement benefit of
(i)&nbsp;each Member who is a highly compensated employee, as defined in Section&nbsp;414(q) of the Code, in the Plan Year in which the Plan is terminated, and (ii)&nbsp;each Member who was a highly compensated employee during (A)&nbsp;the Plan Year
in which the Member retired or otherwise terminated employment with a Contributing Company or (B)&nbsp;any Plan Year ending on or after his attainment of age&nbsp;55, shall be limited so that such retirement benefit is nondiscriminatory under
Section&nbsp;401(a)(4) of the Code. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-62- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) Notwithstanding any other provisions contained in the Plan, the annual retirement benefit which may
be paid to any Member in any Plan Year who (i)&nbsp;is a highly compensated employee, as defined in Section&nbsp;414(q) of the Code, for such Plan Year or (ii)&nbsp;was a highly compensated employee during (A)&nbsp;the Plan Year in which the Member
retired or otherwise terminated employment with a Contributing Company or Affiliate (B)&nbsp;any Plan Year ending on or after his attainment of age&nbsp;55 shall be limited to an amount equal to the payments that would be made on behalf of the
Member under a straight life annuity which is the Actuarial Equivalent of the Accrued Benefit and other benefits to which the Member is entitled under the Plan. The restrictions of this paragraph shall only be applicable if the Member is in the
group of 25&nbsp;highly compensated employees with the greatest total compensation in the current or any prior Plan Year. In addition, the restrictions of this paragraph shall not apply if </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(1) after payment to such Member of all retirement benefits payable to the Member under the Plan, the value of the Plan&#146;s assets
equals or exceeds 110&nbsp;percent of the value of the Plan&#146;s current liabilities within the meaning of Section&nbsp;412(l)(7) of the Code; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(2) the present value of all retirement benefits payable to the Member under the Plan is less than one percent of the value of the Plan&#146;s current liabilities (as determined prior to the distribution of the
Member&#146;s benefits); </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(3) the present value of all retirement benefits payable to the Member under the Plan does not
exceed $5,000; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-63- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(4) the Member ceases to be in the group of 25&nbsp;highly compensated employees
described in the preceding sentence; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(5) the Member (A)&nbsp;enters into an agreement with the Committee, in a form
satisfactory to the Committee, which provides for the repayment of amounts received in excess of such restrictions and (B)&nbsp;adequately secures such repayment obligation, in accordance with Internal Revenue Service Ruling&nbsp;92-76, through the
pledge of an individual retirement account, the establishment of an escrow account or by posting a bond from an insurance company or a letter of credit from a bank; or </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(6) the Plan has terminated and all Members have received distributions of their Accrued Benefits under the Plan. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The provisions of this Section&nbsp;are intended to comply with the requirements of Section&nbsp;1.401(a)(4)-5(b) of the Income Tax Regulations and shall cease to be
applicable without the need for Plan amendment if the Internal Revenue Service determines that such provisions are not necessary to prevent the prohibited discrimination that may occur in the event of an early termination of the Plan. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">13.4 <U>Consolidations, Mergers or Transfers of Assets</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the case of any merger or consolidation with, or transfer of Plan assets or liabilities to, any other plan, each Member shall have a benefit in the resulting successor or transferee plan (determined as if such plan
had terminated immediately after such transaction), that shall be equal to or greater than the benefit he would have been entitled </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-64- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">to receive immediately before such transaction under the plan in which he was then a member if such plan had then terminated. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE XIV. <U>Miscellaneous.</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">14.1 The establishment
of the Plan shall not be considered as a contract or consideration for employment, nor shall it interfere with the right of any Contributing Company to discharge any Employee or treat him without regard to the existence of the Plan. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">14.2 Except as otherwise required by law (including a qualified domestic relations order as defined in Section&nbsp;414(p) of the Code), no benefit
hereunder shall in any manner or to any extent be assignable or transferable by the Member, his spouse or his beneficiary, or subject to attachment, garnishment or other legal process. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">14.3 Wherever used in this instrument, a masculine pronoun shall be deemed to include the masculine and feminine gender, and a singular word shall be
deemed to include the singular and plural, in all cases where the context so requires. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">14.4 All questions pertaining to the construction,
regulation, validity and effect of the provisions of the Plan shall be determined in accordance with the laws of the United States and to the extent not superseded by such laws in accordance with the laws of the State of New York. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">14.5 Notwithstanding any provision of the Plan to the contrary, effective December&nbsp;12, 1994, benefits and service credit with respect to qualified
military service will be provided in accordance with Section&nbsp;414(u) of the Code. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-65- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE XV. <U>Top-Heavy Provisions.</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">15.1 <U>Top-Heavy Rules</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">With respect to any Plan Year in which the Plan is a Top-Heavy Plan, the
special rules regarding the vesting of benefits upon termination of employment and the minimum Accrued Benefit as described under this Article&nbsp;XV shall apply, notwithstanding any provision of the Plan to the contrary. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">15.2 <U>Vesting Upon Termination of Employment</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">If a Member&#146;s employment is terminated subsequent to the completion of 3&nbsp;years of Continuous Service (or attainment of age 55, if earlier), the Member shall be fully (100%)&nbsp;vested as to his Accrued Benefit. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">15.3 <U>Minimum Accrued Benefit</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As of
the end of any Plan Year as of which the Plan is a Top-Heavy Plan, the Accrued Benefit of each Member who is not a Key-Employee shall not be less than the product of (a)&nbsp;and (b)&nbsp;below: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) 2% multiplied by the Member&#146;s Years of Service with the employer (not greater than 20%), </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) the Member&#146;s Average Compensation in the Testing Period. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Notwithstanding the foregoing, this Section&nbsp;15.3 shall not be applicable for any Plan Year in which a Member receives the minimum required
contribution from a Contributing Company under the Profit-Sharing Plan or another defined contribution plan maintained by the Company or any Affiliate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-66- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">15.4 <U>Top-Heavy Plan</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Plan shall be treated as a Top-Heavy Plan with respect to a Plan Year if the Aggregation Group is a Top-Heavy Group. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">15.5 <U>Top-Heavy Group</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Aggregation Group shall be treated as a Top-Heavy Group with respect to a
Plan Year if, as of the Determination Date, the sum of (i)&nbsp;the present value of the cumulative accrued benefits for Key Employees who are Members under the Plan and any other defined benefit pension plan in the Aggregation Group, and
(ii)&nbsp;the aggregate of the accounts of Key Employees under each defined contribution plan (as defined in Section&nbsp;414(i) of the Code) in the Aggregation Group, exceeds 60% of the sum of the present value of accrued benefits and the value of
accounts for Key Employees and Non-Key Employees under each Qualified Plan in the Aggregation Group. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In determining the present value of
accrued benefits and the aggregate value of accounts there shall be included any distributions made from the Qualified Plan with respect to the Key Employee or Non-Key Employee during the five-year period ending on the Determination Date and there
shall be excluded the present value of accrued benefits and the value of accounts with respect to a Key Employee or Non Key Employee who has not received any Compensation from the Company at any time during the five-year period ending on the
Determination Date. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">15.6 <U>Definitions</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) &#147;Aggregation Group&#148; means each Qualified Plan in which one or more Key Employees are participants, each Qualified Plan that enables a Qualified Plan </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-67- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">in which one or more Key Employees are participants to satisfy the requirements of Section&nbsp;401(a)(4) or Section&nbsp;410 of the Code, and each other
Qualified Plan that the Company designates as part of the Aggregation Group, provided that the resulting Aggregation Group satisfies the requirements of Section&nbsp;401(a)(4) and Section&nbsp;410 of the Code. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) &#147;Average Compensation in the Testing Period&#148; means a Member&#146;s average compensation (within the meaning of
Section&nbsp;415(c)(3) of the Code) for the 5&nbsp;consecutive Plan Years during which the Member had the greatest aggregate compensation; provided, however, only Plan Years which constitute Years of Service while this Plan is top heavy shall be
taken into account. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) &#147;Determination Date&#148; means for any Plan Year the last day of the preceding Plan Year.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%;line-Height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d) &#147;Key Employee&#148; means any Employee or former Employee any Employee or
former Employee (and the beneficiaries of such Employee) who at any time during the Plan Year containing the Determination Date or any of the preceding four Plan Years was (i)&nbsp;an officer of the Company or any Affiliate if such individual&#146;s
annual compensation exceeds 50% of the dollar limitation under Section&nbsp;415(b)(1)(A) of the Code, (ii)&nbsp;an owner (or considered an owner under Section&nbsp;318 of the Code) of both more than an <FONT SIZE="1"><SUP>&nbsp;1</SUP></FONT><FONT
SIZE="2">/</FONT><FONT SIZE="1">2</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> percent interest as well as one of the ten largest interests in the Company or any Affiliate if such individual&#146;s annual compensation exceeds 100% of
the dollar limitation under Section&nbsp;415(c)(1)(A) of the Code, (iii)&nbsp;a five-percent owner of the Company or any Affiliate, or (iv)&nbsp;a one-percent owner of the Company or any Affiliate </FONT></FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-68- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">who has an annual compensation of more than $150,000. &#147;Annual compensation&#148; means compensation as defined in Section&nbsp;415(c)(3) of the Code,
and for all Plan Years includes amounts contributed by the Company or any Affiliate pursuant to a salary reduction agreement which are excludable from the employee&#146;s gross income under Sections 125, 132(f)(4) (for Plan Years beginning on or
after January&nbsp;1, 2001), 402(e)(3), 402(h) or 403(b) of the Code. The determination period is the Plan Year containing the Determination Date and the four preceding Plan Years. The determination of who is a Key Employee will be made in
accordance with Section&nbsp;416(i)(1) of the Code and the applicable regulations and other guidance of general applicability issued thereunder. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(e) &#147;Non-Key Employee&#148; means any Employee who is not a Key Employee. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(f)
&#147;Qualified Plan&#148; means any plan maintained by the Company or a Subsidiary, Contributing Company or other Affiliate which satisfies the qualification requirements of Section&nbsp;401(a) of the Code. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">15.7 <U>Modification of Top-Heavy Rules</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) This Section shall apply for purposes of determining whether the Plan is a top-heavy plan under Section&nbsp;416(g) of the Code for Plan Years beginning after December&nbsp;31, 2001, and whether the Plan satisfies
the minimum benefits requirements of Section&nbsp;416(c) of the Code for such years. This Section&nbsp;15.7 amends the previous Sections of this Article XV. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-69- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) Determination of top-heavy status. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) &#147;Key Employee&#148; means any Employee or former Employee (including any deceased Employee) who at any time during the Plan Year
that includes the Determination Date was an officer of the Company having annual compensation greater than $130,000 (as adjusted under Section&nbsp;416(i)(1) of the Code for Plan Years beginning after December&nbsp;31, 2002), a 5-percent owner of
the Company or any Affiliates, or a 1-percent owner of the Company or its Affiliates having annual compensation of more than $150,000. For this purpose, &#147;annual compensation&#148; means compensation within the meaning of Section&nbsp;415(c)(3)
of the Code. The determination of who is a Key Employee will be made in accordance with Section&nbsp;416(i)(l) of the Code and the applicable regulations and other guidance of general applicability issued thereunder. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) This Section&nbsp;15.7(ii) shall apply for purposes of determining the present values of accrued benefits and the amounts of account
balances of Employees as of the Determination Date. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:13%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(A) The present values of accrued benefits and the amounts of account
balances of an Employee as of the Determination Date shall be increased by the distributions made with respect to the Employee under the Plan and any plan aggregated with the Plan under Section&nbsp;416(g)(2) of the Code during the 1-year period
ending on the Determination Date. The preceding sentence shall also apply to distributions under a </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-70- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:13%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">terminated plan which, had it not been terminated, would have been aggregated with the Plan under Section&nbsp;416(g)(2)(A)(i) of the Code. In the case of a
distribution made for a reason other than separation from service, death, or disability, this provision shall be applied by substituting &#147;5-year period&#148; for &#147;1-year period.&#148; </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:13%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(B) The accrued benefits and accounts of any individual who has not performed services for the Company or any Affiliate during the 1-year
period ending on the Determination Date shall not be taken into account. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-71- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">IN WITNESS WHEREOF, The Bank of New York Company, Inc. has caused this document to be executed, on its
behalf, this 21st day of December, 2006. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV ALIGN="right">

STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Conversions of normal form of payment to Option 5 are based on rounded ages. Participants born on the 15</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"
COLOR="#000000"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> day or earlier in a month are assumed to be born on the first day of that month.</FONT></P></TD></TR>

SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All J&amp;S Options,</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All Certain
and Life Options,</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Domestic Partner Benefits (other than for Lump Sum
determination),</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adjustment for Life Expectancy in QDRO Calculations,</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Top-Heavy Testing,</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any Other Plan Purpose for Which Factors are not Specified</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Conversions of normal form of payment to Options 1 and 2 are based on actual age (years and months). Participants born on the 15</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1" COLOR="#000000"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> day or earlier in a month are assumed to be born on the first day of that month.</FONT></P></TD></TR>
</TABLE>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>APPENDIX I </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">ARTICLE I. <U>Highland National Members.</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.1 The provisions of this Article&nbsp;I shall apply only to Members who are
employed as of May&nbsp;3, 1982 at the branch offices located at (i)&nbsp;25 Quaker Avenue, Cornwall, New York, (ii)&nbsp;20 Front Street, Port Jervis, New York and (iii)&nbsp;One Grant Plaza, Port Jervis, New York, and become employees of Highland
National Bank of Newburgh (&#147;Highland National&#148;) as a result of the sale of such branch offices by the Company to Highland National on such date. For purposes of Article I, such Members shall be referred to as Highland National Members.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.2 For all purposes of the Plan, except as set forth under the following provisions of this Article&nbsp;I, service by a Highland
National Member with Highland National shall constitute service with a Contributing Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.3 Notwithstanding any provision of the Plan
to the contrary, a Highland National Member shall accrue Continuous Service, but not Credited Service, under the Plan for his service with Highland National. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">ARTICLE II. <U>Union State Members.</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.1 The provisions of this Article&nbsp;II shall apply only to Members who are employed as
of January&nbsp;17, 1983 at the branch offices located at (i)&nbsp;One Broadway, Haverstraw, New York, (ii)&nbsp;Route 9-W &amp; Railroad Road, Haverstraw, New York, (iii)&nbsp;45&nbsp;Kennedy Drive, Spring Valley, New York and
(iv)&nbsp;115&nbsp;South Main Street, New City, New York, and become employees of Union State Bank located in Nanuet, New </FONT>
</P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">York (&#147;Union State&#148;), as a result of the sale of such branch offices by the Company to Union State on such date. For purposes of Article II, such
Members shall be referred to as Union State Members. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.2 For all purposes of the Plan, except as set forth under the following provision
of this Article&nbsp;II, service by a Union State Member with Union State shall constitute service with a Contributing Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.3
Notwithstanding any provision of the Plan to the contrary, a Union State Member shall accrue Continuous Service, but not Credited Service, under the Plan for his service with Union State. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE III. <U>Schenectady Members.</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.1 The provisions
of this Article&nbsp;III shall apply only to Members who are employed as of January&nbsp;1, 1984 at the branch offices subject to the purchase agreement between the Company and The Schenectady Trust Company (&#147;Schenectady&#148;) and become
employees of Schenectady (or a subsidiary) as a result of such sale on January&nbsp;1, 1984. For purposes of this Article&nbsp;III, such Members shall be referred to as Schenectady Members. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.2 For all purposes of the Plan, except as set forth under the following provision of this Article&nbsp;III, service by a Schenectady Member with
Schenectady (or a subsidiary) shall constitute service with a Contributing Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.3 Notwithstanding any provision of the Plan to the
contrary, a Schenectady Member shall accrue Continuous Service, but not Credited Service, under the Plan for his service with Schenectady (or a subsidiary). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I-2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE IV. <U>Key Banks Members; Community Bank Members.</U> </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.1 The provisions of this Article&nbsp;IV shall apply only to Members who, as a result of the sale of certain branch offices by the Company to Key Banks,
Inc., located in Albany, New York (&#147;Key Banks&#148;), and in accordance with the terms of the purchase agreement covering such sale, become employees of Key Banks (or a subsidiary) on the closing date of the sale on account of their employment
at such branch offices as of the closing date, including Members who subsequently become employees of Community Bank Systems, Inc. (&#147;Community Bank&#148;), or a subsidiary, on or about June&nbsp;30, 1984, pursuant to a purchase agreement
between Key Banks and Community Bank. For purposes of Article IV, such Members shall be referred to as Key Banks Members or Community Bank Members, as appropriate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.2 For all purposes of the Plan, except as set forth under the following provision of this Article&nbsp;IV, service by a Key Banks Member with Key Banks (or a subsidiary) or by a Community Bank Member with Community
Bank (or a subsidiary) shall constitute service with a Contributing Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.3 Notwithstanding any provision of the Plan to the
contrary, a Key Banks Member shall accrue Continuous Service, but not Credited Service, under the Plan for his service with Key Banks (or a subsidiary) and a Community Bank Member shall accrue Continuous Service, but not Credited Service, under the
Plan for his service with Community Bank (or a subsidiary). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I-3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE V. <U>Norstar Members.</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5.1 The provisions of this Article&nbsp;V shall apply only to Members who, as a result of the sale of certain branch offices by the Company to Norstar Bancorp,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;Norstar&#148;), and in accordance with
the terms of the purchase agreement covering such sale, become employees of Norstar (or a subsidiary) on the closing date of the sale on account of their employment at such branch offices as of the closing date. For purposes of Article&nbsp;V, such
Members shall be referred to as Norstar Members. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5.2 For all purposes of the Plan, except as set forth under the following provision of
this Article&nbsp;V, service by a Norstar Member with Norstar (or a subsidiary) shall constitute service with a Contributing Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5.3
Notwithstanding any provision of the Plan to the contrary, a Norstar Member shall accrue Continuous Service, but not Credited Service, under the Plan for his service with Norstar (or a subsidiary). </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE VI. <U>Irving Retirement Plan Members.</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.1 The
provisions of this Article&nbsp;VI shall apply to Members who were members of the Retirement Plan of Irving Bank Corporation and Affiliated Companies (the &#147;Irving Retirement Plan&#148;) on December&nbsp;31, 1992. For purposes of this
Article&nbsp;VI, such Members shall be referred to as Irving Retirement Plan Members. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.2 The Irving Retirement Plan was merged into the
Plan, effective as of December&nbsp;31, 1992. Each Irving Retirement Plan Member shall become a Member in this Plan as of January&nbsp;1, 1993. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I-4 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.3 The Accrued Benefit of an Irving Retirement Plan Member shall be equal to the sum of (i)&nbsp;the
annual amount, if any, of the normal retirement benefit payable as of such Member&#146;s Normal Retirement Date determined in accordance with the provisions of Section&nbsp;5.1 of the Plan, and (ii)&nbsp;the retirement income payable to such Member
on his normal retirement date under the terms of the Irving Retirement Plan as of December&nbsp;31, 1992. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.4 The Compensation of an
Irving Retirement Plan Member for years beginning prior to January&nbsp;1, 1993 shall be taken into account for purposes of determining such Member&#146;s Average Final Compensation under this Plan, as if the Continuous Service of an Irving
Retirement Plan Member was also considered to be Credited Service. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.5 Irving Retirement Plan Members who, as of December&nbsp;31, 1992,
are receiving benefits under the Company&#146;s long-term disability plan, shall accrue Credited Service under Section&nbsp;2.3 of this Plan after December&nbsp;31, 1992 only if they had not attained age&nbsp;60 as of December&nbsp;31, 1992.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.6 The service of an Irving Retirement Plan Member with Irving Bank Corporation and its subsidiaries shall be included in the Continuous
Service of such Member, but such service shall not be counted in determining the Member&#146;s Credited Service. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.7 The Accrued Benefit
of an Irving Retirement Plan Member who as of December&nbsp;31, 1992 had (i)&nbsp;retired or terminated employment and (ii)&nbsp;had not commenced payment of benefits under the Irving Retirement Plan shall be payable in accordance with the forms of
retirement income provided under the Irving Retirement </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I-5 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Plan. If payment of the Accrued Benefit of an Irving Retirement Plan Member had commenced as of December&nbsp;31, 1992, payment thereof shall continue in the
form provided under the Irving Retirement Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:3px; text-indent:4%;line-Height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.8 For purposes of Section&nbsp;9.2 of the Plan, the
actuarial reduction shall apply to each month by which commencement of benefits precedes such Member&#146;s attainment of age 65 with respect to the portion of the Accrued Benefit of an Irving Retirement Plan Member equal to the retirement income
payable to such Member on his normal retirement date under the terms of the Irving Retirement Plan as of December&nbsp;31, 1992. The amount of such actuarial reduction shall be </FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"
COLOR="#000000"><SUP>5</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"><I>/</I></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#000000"><SUB>9</SUB></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> of 1% for each of
the first 60 months, and </FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#000000"><SUP>5</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"><I>/</I></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"
COLOR="#000000"><SUB>18</SUB></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> of 1% for each of the next 60 months, preceding the Member&#146;s 65</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#000000"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> birthday. In the event of a disposition referred to in Section&nbsp;4.4 of the Plan, the first sentence of this Section&nbsp;shall be applied by substituting &#147;age&nbsp;60&#148; for
&#147;age&nbsp;65&#148; with respect to a Member employed by the Former Affiliate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE VII. <U>National Community Bank Retirement Plan Members</U>.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7.1 The provisions of this Article&nbsp;VII shall apply, effective August&nbsp;11, 1994, to Members who were members of the Retirement
Plan of National Community Bank of New Jersey (the &#147;National Community Bank Retirement Plan&#148;) on August&nbsp;10, 1994. For purposes of Article&nbsp;VII, such Members shall be referred to as National Community Bank Retirement Plan Members.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I-6 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7.2 The National Community Bank Retirement Plan was merged into the Plan, effective as of August&nbsp;11,
1994. Each National Community Bank Retirement Plan Member shall become a Member in this Plan as of August&nbsp;11, 1994. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7.3 In no event
will the Accrued Benefit of a National Community Bank Retirement Plan Member be less than the Member&#146;s accrued benefit under the terms of the National Community Bank Retirement Plan as of August&nbsp;10, 1994 (referred to hereinafter as the
&#147;Frozen NCB Benefit&#148;). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7.4 If a National Community Bank Retirement Plan Member as of August&nbsp;10, 1994 had (i)&nbsp;retired
or terminated employment and (ii)&nbsp;not commenced to receive payment of his Frozen NCB Benefit, (A)&nbsp;such Member&#146;s Accrued Benefit shall be equal to the Member&#146;s Frozen NCB Benefit and (B)&nbsp;if such Member&#146;s Accrued Benefit
commences to be paid before the Member attains age&nbsp;65, it shall be reduced for each month by which commencement of benefits precedes the Member&#146;s attainment of age 65 in accordance with the terms of the National Community Bank Retirement
Plan as of August&nbsp;10, 1994. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7.5 The Frozen NCB Benefit of a National Community Bank Retirement Plan Member who as of August&nbsp;10,
1994 had (i)&nbsp;retired or terminated employment and (ii)&nbsp;not commenced payment of benefits under the National Community Bank Retirement Plan shall be payable in accordance with the forms of payment provided under the National Community Bank
Retirement Plan. If payment of the Frozen NCB Benefit of a National Community Bank Retirement Plan Member had commenced as of </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I-7 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">August&nbsp;10, 1994, payment thereof shall continue in the form in effect under the National Community Bank Retirement Plan. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7.6 If the Accrued Benefit of a National Community Bank Retirement Plan Member who had not retired or terminated employment as of August&nbsp;10, 1994
commences to be paid before such Member attains age&nbsp;65, the amount of the retirement benefit payable to the Member shall be equal to the greater of (i)&nbsp;the Member&#146;s Accrued Benefit under the Plan, reduced pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.3
or Section&nbsp;9.2, as appropriate, and (ii)&nbsp;the Member&#146;s Frozen NCB Benefit, reduced for each month by which commencement of benefits precedes the Member&#146;s attainment of age&nbsp;65 in accordance with the terms of the National
Community Bank Retirement Plan as of August&nbsp;10, 1994. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE VIII. <U>Putnam Trust Company Retirement Plan Members</U>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.1 The provisions of this Article&nbsp;VIII shall apply to Members who were members of the Retirement Plan for Employees of The Putnam Trust Company of
Greenwich (the &#147;Putnam Trust Company Retirement Plan&#148;) on October&nbsp;31, 1995. For purposes of this Article&nbsp;VIII, such Members shall be referred to as Putnam Trust Company Retirement Plan Members. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.2 The Putnam Trust Company Retirement Plan was merged into the Plan, effective as of November&nbsp;1, 1995. Each Putnam Trust Company Retirement Plan
Member shall become a Member in this Plan as of November&nbsp;1, 1995. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.3 In no event will the Accrued Benefit of a Putnam Trust Company
Retirement Plan Member be less than the sum of (i)&nbsp;the Member&#146;s accrued benefit under </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I-8 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the terms of the Putnam Trust Company Retirement Plan as of October&nbsp;31, 1995 (referred to hereinafter as the &#147;Frozen Putnam Trust Company
Benefit&#148;) and (ii)&nbsp;the Member&#146;s Accrued Benefit under the Plan determined by excluding all service with Putnam Trust Company and its predecessors prior to the date Putnam Trust Company became a Subsidiary. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.4 If a Putnam Trust Company Retirement Plan Member as of October&nbsp;31, 1995 had (i)&nbsp;retired or terminated employment and (ii)&nbsp;not
commenced to receive payment of his Frozen Putnam Trust Company Benefit, (A)&nbsp;such Member&#146;s Accrued Benefit shall be equal to the Member&#146;s Frozen Putnam Trust Company Benefit and (B)&nbsp;if such Member&#146;s Accrued Benefit commences
to be paid before the Member attains age&nbsp;65, it shall be reduced for each month by which commencement of benefits precedes the Member&#146;s attainment of age 65 in accordance with the terms of the Putnam Trust Company Retirement Plan as of
October&nbsp;31, 1995. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.5 The Frozen Putnam Trust Company Benefit of a Putnam Trust Company Retirement Plan Member who as of
October&nbsp;31, 1995 had (i)&nbsp;retired or terminated employment and (ii)&nbsp;not commenced payment of benefits under the Putnam Trust Company Retirement Plan shall be payable in accordance with the forms of payment provided under the Putnam
Trust Company Retirement Plan. If payment of the Frozen Putnam Trust Company Benefit of a Putnam Trust Company Retirement Plan Member had commenced as of October&nbsp;31, 1995, payment thereof shall continue in the form in effect under the Putnam
Trust Company Retirement Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I-9 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.6 If the Accrued Benefit of a Putnam Trust Company Retirement Plan Member who had not retired or
terminated employment as of October&nbsp;31, 1995 commences to be paid before such Member attains age&nbsp;65, the amount of the retirement benefit payable to the Member shall be equal to the greater of (i)&nbsp;the Member&#146;s Accrued Benefit
under the Plan, reduced pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.3 or Section&nbsp;9.2 of the Plan, as appropriate, and (ii)&nbsp;the sum of (A)&nbsp;the Member&#146;s Frozen Putnam Trust Company Benefit, reduced for each month by which commencement of benefits
precedes the Member&#146;s attainment of age&nbsp;65 in accordance with the terms of the Putnam Trust Company Retirement Plan as of October&nbsp;31, 1995 and (B)&nbsp;the Member&#146;s Accrued Benefit under the Plan determined by excluding all
service with Putnam Trust Company and its predecessors prior to the date Putnam Trust Company became a Subsidiary, reduced pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.3 or Section&nbsp;9.2 of the Plan, as appropriate. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE IX. <U>Certain LITCO Retirement Plan Members</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">9.1 The provisions of this Article&nbsp;IX shall apply to Members who were members of the Employees&#146; Retirement Plan of Long Island Trust Company,&nbsp;N.A. (the &#147;LITCO Retirement Plan&#148;) and retire or terminate employment
under this Plan after December&nbsp;31, 1994. For purposes of Article&nbsp;IX, such Members shall be referred to as LITCO Retirement Plan Members. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">9.2 The Accrued Benefit of a LITCO Retirement Plan Member shall be equal to the sum of (i)&nbsp;the annual amount, if any, of the normal retirement benefit payable as of such Member&#146;s Normal Retirement Date determined in accordance
with the provisions of Section&nbsp;5.1 of the Plan, and (ii)&nbsp;the retirement income payable to such </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I-10 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Member on his normal retirement date under the terms of the LITCO Retirement Plan as of February&nbsp;13, 1987 (the date of the merger of the LITCO
Retirement Plan into this Plan). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">9.3 The service of a LITCO Retirement Plan Member with Long Island Trust Company,&nbsp;N.A. and its
predecessors shall be included in the Continuous Service of such Member, but such service shall not be counted in determining the Member&#146;s Credited Service. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For purposes of Section&nbsp;9.2 of the Plan, the actuarial reduction shall apply to each month by which commencement of benefits precedes such Member&#146;s attainment of age 65 with respect to the portion of the
Accrued Benefit of a LITCO Retirement Plan Member equal to the retirement income payable to such Member on his normal retirement date under the terms of the LITCO Retirement Plan as of February&nbsp;13, 1987. The amount of such actuarial reduction
shall be determined in accordance with the terms of the LITCO Retirement Plan as of February&nbsp;13, 1987. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I-11 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>APPENDIX II </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">ARTICLE I. Special Retirement Window. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.1. The Accrued Benefit of each Eligible Member (as defined in Section&nbsp;1.2 of this
Appendix) who retires on April&nbsp;1, 1989 and has then attained age&nbsp;55 and completed ten years of Continuous Service shall be computed by adding five years of Continuous Service to the years of Continuous Service completed by the Member. In
addition, for purposes of determining the amount of the retirement benefit payable to such Member, his age as of his retirement date shall be deemed to be increased by five. Furthermore, the provisions of this Section&nbsp;shall also be applicable
to the benefit accrued by such Member under the LITCO Retirement Plan (as defined in Section&nbsp;16.2). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.2. For purposes of this
Article, an &#147;Eligible Member&#148; means a Member who (i)&nbsp;is an active Employee, (ii)&nbsp;is temporarily absent with the approval of the Committee, or (iii)&nbsp;ceased active service on account of becoming mentally or physically
incapacitated and continues to be treated as a Member pursuant to Section&nbsp;2.3 of the Plan. In addition, for purposes of this Article, &#147;LITCO Retirement Plan&#148; means the Employees&#146; Retirement Plan of Long Island Trust
Company,&nbsp;N.A., which was replaced by, and merged into, the Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE II. Benefit Increase to Pensioners. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.1. Members who retired (or died in service) prior to January&nbsp;1, 1985 and who are receiving monthly pension benefits (or whose spouses are
receiving death </FONT>
</P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">benefits) shall have such benefits increased, effective with the benefit payable as of January&nbsp;1, 1987, in accordance with the following table:
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

persons entitled to benefits under this Article shall not be less than $10. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.2. Members who retired (or died in service) prior to
January&nbsp;1, 1991 and who are receiving monthly pension benefits (or whose spouses are receiving death benefits) shall have such benefits increased, effective with the benefit payable as of May&nbsp;1, 1997, in accordance with the following
table: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

persons entitled to benefits under this Article shall not be less than $10. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">II-2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.3. The provisions of this Article&nbsp;II shall also apply to former Empire Trust Company employees who
retired prior to the merger with The Bank of New York in 1967. In addition, the monthly pension benefits being paid to such employees directly by The Bank of New York as of January&nbsp;1, 1979 shall, effective with the benefit payable as of
January&nbsp;1, 1980, be funded in and payable from the trust fund to such employees. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ARTICLE III. 2002 Enhanced Retirement Benefit. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.1. Effective February&nbsp;25, 2002, the Accrued Benefit of each Special Member (as defined below (i)&nbsp;whose employment is terminated without Cause
by the Company or any of its subsidiaries (or is notified of such termination without Cause) between February&nbsp;25, 2002 and July&nbsp;31, 2002 or (ii)&nbsp;whose employment was terminated on or after October&nbsp;16, 2001 and with respect to
whom employment charges or litigation filed against the Company or any of its subsidiaries are pending as of July&nbsp;31, 2002, shall be computed by adding three years of Continuous Service to the years of Continuous Service completed by the
Special Member. In addition, for purposes of determining the amount of the retirement benefit payable to such Special Member, his age as of his termination date shall be deemed to be increased by three. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Special
Member must execute a general waiver and release in the form and manner prescribed by the Company to be entitled to the additional three years of Continuous Service and three years of age provided in this section. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.2. For purposes of this Article, a &#147;Special Member&#148; means a Member who (i)&nbsp;is an active Employee or is temporarily absent with the
approval of the Retirement Plan Committee and (ii)&nbsp;has completed five years of Continuous Service (or </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">II-3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">is otherwise fully vested under the Plan) and (iii)&nbsp;attains age 52 on or prior to the date of the Member&#146;s termination of employment. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.3. For purposes of this Article, &#147;Cause&#148; means the Special Member&#146;s having (a)&nbsp;breached any fiduciary duties to the Company or
any of its subsidiaries, (b)&nbsp;failed in a willful and continued manner to substantially perform his duties and responsibilities after a demand for substantial performance is delivered to the Special Member by a direct supervisor or any more
senior executive, which specifically identifies the manner in which the direct supervisor or executive believes that the Special Member has not substantially performed his duties, (c)&nbsp;been convicted of, or has entered a plea of guilty or
<U>nolo contendere</U> to, a felony or lesser crime or offense (other than a minor traffic offense), or (d)&nbsp;violated the Company&#146;s Code of Conduct (or successor rules governing the conduct of the Company&#146;s employees) making the
Special Member subject to dismissal pursuant to the standards set forth therein. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">II-4 </FONT></P>

</BODY></HTML>

</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-31.(A)
<SEQUENCE>10
<FILENAME>dex31a.htm
<DESCRIPTION>CERTIFICATION OF THE CHAIRMAN & CEO - SECTION 302 OF SARBANES OXLEY
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Certification of the Chairman &amp; CEO - Section 302 of Sarbanes Oxley</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>EXHIBIT 31(a) </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">I, Thomas A. Renyi, certify that: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%; text-indent:-2%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1. I have reviewed this annual report on Form 10-K of The Bank of New York
Company, Inc. (the &#147;registrant&#148;); </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2. Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to
state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report; </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3. Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial
condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4. The registrant&#146;s other
certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act
Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such
disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly
during the period in which this report is being prepared; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such
internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with
U.S. generally accepted accounting principles; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures
and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d) Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#146;s
most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#146;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5. The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial
reporting, to the registrant&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions): </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#146;s ability to record,
process, summarize and report financial information; and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other
employees who have a significant role in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Date: February 22, 2007 </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="43%" BORDER="0">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="100%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-bottom:1px;border-bottom:1px solid #000000; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">/s/ Thomas A. Renyi</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Thomas A. Renyi</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Chief Executive Officer</FONT></P></TD></TR>
</TABLE>

<TYPE>EX-31.(B)
<SEQUENCE>11
<FILENAME>dex31b.htm
<DESCRIPTION>CERTIFICATION OF THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER - SECTION 302 OF SARBANES OXLEY
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Certification of the Chief Financial Officer - Section 302 of Sarbanes Oxley</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>EXHIBIT 31(b) </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%; text-indent:-2%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I, Thomas P. Gibbons, certify that: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%; text-indent:-2%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1. I have reviewed this annual report on Form 10-K of The Bank of New York Company, Inc. (the &#147;registrant&#148;); </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.
Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading
with respect to the period covered by this report; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3. Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this
report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4. The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal
control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) Designed such
disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us
by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) Designed such internal control
over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for
external purposes in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) Evaluated the effectiveness of the
registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d) Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the
registrant&#146;s most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#146;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#146;s internal control over
financial reporting; and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5. The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal
control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions): </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably
likely to adversely affect the registrant&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) Any
fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%; text-indent:-2%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Date: February 22, 2007 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="43%" BORDER="0">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="100%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-bottom:1px;border-bottom:1px solid #000000; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">/s/ Thomas P. Gibbons</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Thomas P. Gibbons</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Chief Financial Officer</FONT></P></TD></TR>
</TABLE>
</BODY></HTML>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>EXHIBIT 32(a) </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Certification </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350, the undersigned officer of The Bank of New York Company,
Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) hereby certifies that the Company&#146;s Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 (the &#147;Report&#148;) fully complies with the requirements of Section&nbsp;13(a) or 15(d), as applicable,
of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and that the information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company. </FONT></P> <P
